traits.name: 1: Armour plates
traits.description: Add +2 to the dire animal’s AC, and add +1 to its PD.

traits.name: 2: Spiky bits
traits.description: Whenever an enemy hits the dire animal with a melee attack, deal damage equal to twice the animal’s level to that attacker.

traits.name: 3: Carnage
traits.description: The dire animal’s attacks that miss deal damage equal to its level.  When staggered, its missed attacks deal damage equal to double its level.

traits.name: 4: Poison
traits.description: The dire animal’s main attack also deals 5 ongoing poison damage per tier (5 ongoing poison at levels 1-4, 10 at 5-7, etc.).

traits.name: 5: Dire regeneration
traits.description: When the escalation die is even, this animal heals damage equal to triple its level at the start of its turn.

traits.name: 6: Fury
traits.description: While staggered, the dire animal gains a +2 attack bonus and deals +4 damage, but at the end of each of its turns it takes 2d6 damage.

extraEffects.effect: The target takes +1d6 damage from a claw swipe.
The target takes +2d6 damage from a claw swipe.

abilities.name: Savage
abilities.effect: The dire bear gains a +2 attack bonus against staggered enemies.

abilities.name: One dire feature
abilities.effect: Roll randomly unless you know this beast’s story already.

extraEffects.effect: The fire boar can make a bash attack against a different target as a free action.

attacks.name: Bash
attacks.damage: The target is weakened (-4 to attacks and defences) until the end of the boar’s next turn.

abilities.name: Bestial durability
abilities.effect: When an enemy’s attack has an effect on the dire boar other than damage, the boar can roll and immediate hard save (16+); on a success, it negates that effect.

abilities.name: Last stand
abilities.effect: The board doesn’t die until it reaches -60 hp.  While at 0 hp or below but more than -60 hp, it must roll a normal save at the end of each of its turns; on a failure it dies.

abilities.name: One random dire feature
abilities.effect: Use the dire features table or add something spicy.

nastierSpecials.name: Furious streak
nastierSpecials.effect: When the dire boar can make a bash attack, if it isn’t engaged with a different enemy, as a free action it can pop free of the enemy engaged with it and mvoe to a nearby enemy to make that bash attack.

nastierSpecials.name: Squealing pack attack
nastierSpecials.effect: This creature gains +1 attack bonus per other dire rat engaged with the target it’s attacking.

attacks.name: Pounce
attacks.damage: 38 damage, and the target is hampered while it’s engaged with the tiger

abilities.name: Pouncing opportunity
abilities.effect: When an enemy moves to engage the dire tiger while it’s unengaged, it can meet that enemy halfway and make a pounch attack as an interrupt action before the target’s attack.

abilities.name: Springing attack
abilities.effect: If the dire tiger is unengaged and moves to engage an enemy (with a springing leap), it can make a pounce attack as a standard action.

abilities.name: One random dire feature
abilities.effect: Use the dire features table.

extraEffects.effect: This creature gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage for each other ally engaged with the target (max +4 bonus).

abilities.name: Chilling howl
abilities.effect: Whenever a dire wolf’s attack drops an enemy to 0 hp or below, all dire wolves in the battle can howl as a free action.  When the wolves howl, each enemy in the battle takes a penalty to its attacks and all defences equal to the number of living dire wolves in the battle (max -5) until the end of the attacking wolf’s next turn.  New howls extend the duration of the current howl rather than downgrading the howl’s effect if dire wolves have been slain in the meantime.

abilities.name: One dire feature
abilities.effect: Roll randomly unless you know this beast’s story already.

extraEffects.effect: The target also takes 1d3 ongoing acid damage.

abilities.name: Wall-crawler
abilities.effect: A giant ant can climb on ceilings and walls as easily as it moves on the ground.

attacks.name: Jagged claws
attacks.damage: 30 damage, and if the target’s initiative bonus is +10 or less, the target is grabbed until it disengages or until the mantis makes a jagged claws attack against a different target

abilities.name: Close fighting
abilities.effect: When an enemy fails a disengage check against the dire mantis, the mantis can make an opportunity attack against it.

abilities.name: Big but brittle
abilities.effect: While the dire mantis might rate as a huge monster in terms of size, its stats are based on those for a large monster.

abilities.name: One random dire feature
abilities.effect: Use the dire features table.

nastierSpecials.name: Clacking mandibles
nastierSpecials.effect: When the dire mantis starts its turn grabbing an enemy, it can make a chomp attack against that enemy as a free action.

attacks.name: Pincer
attacks.damage: 1 damage, and the scorpion gains a +2 attack bonus against the same target this turn with its stinger attack

extraEffects.effect: 2/round, each requiring a quick action. (Hitting the same target twice with pincer gives the string attack a +4 bonus.)
The target also takes 2d6 ongoing poison damage if it’s dazed or stuck.

attacks.name: Web
attacks.target: up to 2 nearby enemies in a group
attacks.damage: 3 damage, and the target is dazed until the end of the spider’s next turn

extraEffects.effect: The target is also stuck until the end of the spider’s next turn.

abilities.name: Wall-crawler
abilities.effect: A giant web spider can climb on ceilings and walls as easily as it moves on the ground.

extraEffects.effect: The target also takes 1d8 ongoing poison damage.

abilities.name: Scuttle
abilities.effect: A hunting spider can turn its own failed disengage check into a success by taking 1d4 damage.

abilities.name: Wall-crawler
abilities.effect: A hunting spider can climb on ceilings and walls as easily as it moves on the ground.

extraEffects.effect: This creature gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage for each other ally engaged with the target (max +4 damage).
If the target is small (i.e. a gnome or halfling), the ankheg grabs it. While the ankheg is grabbing a creature, the only legal target for its mandibles attack is the grabbed creature.

attacks.name: Acid spit
attacks.target: one nearby enemy, plus any enemy the ankheg has grabbed

extraEffects.effect: 1/round, as a quick action.

abilities.name: Escape speed
abilities.effect: At the end of the ankheg’s turn, roll a d6.  If it’s equal to or less than the escalation die, the ankheg can move again as a free action.

extraEffects.effect: 4 ongoing fire damage.

abilities.name: Blistering heat
abilities.effect: When an enemy engaged with the azer attacks it, that enemy takes 2 fire damage.

abilities.name: Fighting surge
abilities.effect: Once per battle when an attack crits the azer but doesn’t kill it, the azer can heal 4d6 hp.

abilities.name: Cold haters
abilities.effect: The azer adds the escalation die to its attacks against a target that is capable of dealing cold damage with a spell, attack, or magic item.

abilities.name: Fire resistance 18+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 18+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

extraEffects.effect: The target takes 6 extra fire damage.

attacks.name: Molten spray
attacks.damage: 8 fire damage, and the brute loses 12 hit points

extraEffects.effect: 1/battle, only while the brute is staggered.

abilities.name: Blistering heat
abilities.effect: When an enemy engaged with the brute attacks it, that enemy takes 2 fire damage.

abilities.name: Fire resistance 18+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 18+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

attacks.name: Multi-legged attack
attacks.target: 3 attacks, each against a different enemy

extraEffects.effect: The target takes 5 ongoing poison damage.

attacks.name: Basilisk’s stare
attacks.damage: 5 ongoing poison damage, and the target must start making last gasp saves depending on the basilisk’s type as it accidently takes a full look at the basilisk.  Constructs and undead are immune to this effect

extraEffects.effect: The target’s blood begins to coagulate and harden, and dust puffs out of their lungs through their mouth.
The target’s body turns to stone and they die.

abilities.name: Basilisk’s stare
abilities.effect: When a basilisk hits an enemy that is already taking ongoing poison damage, the basilisk can make a basilisk’s stare attack against the target as a free action.

abilities.name: Resist melee damage 18+
abilities.effect: When a melee attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 18+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage. An attacker can ignore this resistance by declaring they are looking directly at the basilisk during the attack. If they do, the basilisk can make a basilisk’s stare attack against them as a free action before the attack. Constructs and undead are not affected by this resistance.

abilities.name: Stare-down
abilities.effect: When an enemy makes a ranged attack against the basilisk, the basilisk can make a basilisk’s stare attack against them as a free action before the attack.

nastierSpecials.name: Death breath
nastierSpecials.effect: Each creature engaged with the basilisk at the end of the basilisk’s turn takes 10 poison damage.

extraEffects.effect: The dire bat pops free from the target and can move as a free action.

abilities.name: Resist ranged damage 16+
abilities.effect: When a ranged attack targets this creature while it’s flying, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.  (Shifty spinning bats are hard to hit unless they’re grounded or stuck.)

abilities.name: Skittish
abilities.effect: A dire bat engaged with a conscious enemy after attacking it will attempt to disengage and fly into the air if it has a move action remaining that turn.

nastierSpecials.name: Blood drinker
nastierSpecials.effect: When the dire bat drops an enemy to 0 hp or below, it continues to attack that enemy (until it dies) instead of attacking other enemies.

nastierSpecials.name: Dire feature
nastierSpecials.effect: This bat is a dire animal and has a dire feature.

attacks.name: Fangs, wings, and sword
attacks.damage: Damage and effect depends on the natural roll

extraEffects.effect: The target takes 10 damage from a sword strike, and the bat cavalry pops free from the target and can move as a free action.

extraEffects.trigger: Natural even miss against a target taking ongoing damage
extraEffects.effect: The target takes 6 damage from clawing wings.
The target takes 8 damage, and 5 ongoing damage from bat fangs.
In addition to any other effect, the bat cavalry pops free from the target, and as a free action, it can move to another nearby enemy and make a fangs, wings, and sword attack against it.

abilities.name: Fiery flier
abilities.effect: An unengaged fire bat can move, and make a burning contrail attack, and move away from the target as a standard action without taking an opportunity attack from the target.

abilities.name: Blistering heat
abilities.effect: When an enemy engaged with the fire bat attacks it, that enemy takes 2 fire damage.

abilities.name: Fire resistance 16+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: Fire bats are agile fliers, especially when riding hot air currents.  They slow down a bit away from warmth.

extraEffects.effect: The goblin bat mage pops free from the target and can move as a free action.
If the target is staggered after taking the damage, it’s also hampered until the end of its next turn.
One random nearby ally of the target takes 2d6 negative energy damage.

abilities.name: Resist ranged damage 16+
abilities.effect: When a ranged attack targets this creature while it’s flying, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Skittish
abilities.effect: A goblin bat mage engaged with a conscious enemy after attacking it will attempt to disengage and fly into the air if it has a move action remaining that turn.

abilities.name: Unwieldly flier
abilities.effect: When the goblin bat mage is staggered, it must roll an immediate save.  On a failure, it loses its ability to fly until the end of its next turn.  If flying near the ground, it lands immediately.  If flying far away from the ground it lands badly and takes 15 damage.

attacks.name: Swarming bits
attacks.damage: 2 damage, and after the attack, the swarm of bats engages one of the targets

extraEffects.effect: The target is hampered until the end of its next turn.  It can end the effect by attacking the swarm, or if the swarm drops to 0 hp.

abilities.name: No opportunities
abilities.effect: The swarm of bats can’t make opportunity attacks, and enemies can’t make opportunity attacks against it.

abilities.name: Swarming resistance
abilities.effect: Each turn, the swarm of bats gains resist damage 18+ to all damage from attacks by enemies that the swarm did NOT attack that turn.

extraEffects.trigger: Natural even hit against a dazed enemy
extraEffects.effect: The target takes 20 ongoing thunder damage.
The target is dazed (save ends).

abilities.name: Resist ranged damage 16+
abilities.effect: When a ranged attack targets this creature while it’s flying, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Resist thunder 18+
abilities.effect: When a thunder attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Unwieldly flier
abilities.effect: When the thunder bat is staggered, it must roll an immediate save.  On a failure, it loses its ability to fly until the end of its next turn.  If flying near the ground, it lands immediately.  If flying far away from the ground, it lands badly and takes 25 damage.

attacks.name: Ghostly fangs
attacks.damage: 25 negative energy damage, and the target takes +1d8 negative energy damage for each relationship point it has with the Lich King

attacks.name: Spiraling assault
attacks.damage: 22 negative energy damage, and after the attack the wraith bat teleports to and engages with one target it hit

extraEffects.effect: Regardless of the number of wraith bats in the battle, only one wraith bat can use this attack each round.

abilities.name: Ghostly
abilities.effect: This creature has resist damage 16+ to all damage except force damage, which damages it normally. A wraith bat can move through solid objects bit it can’t end its movement inside them.

extraEffects.effect: If both claws hit during the same turn, the bulette can make a terrible bite attack during its next turn as a standard action.
22 damage.

abilities.name: Blood frenzy
abilities.effect: The bulette’s crit range expands to 16+ while the escalation die is 4+.

abilities.name: Serious burrower
abilities.effect: A bulette can burrow incredibly quickly for short distances.  They’re renowned for the mounds of dirt and rock they push above them as they surge through the ground like land torpedoes.

nastierSpecials.name: Savage response
nastierSpecials.effect: When an attacker scores a critical hit against the bulette and it survives, the bulette can make a terrible bite attack as a free action against one target engaged with it.

extraEffects.effect: 45 damage.

abilities.name: Blood frenzy
abilities.effect: The deep bulette’s crit range expands by 4 while the escalation die is 4+.

abilities.name: Tunnel fighter
abilities.effect: While fighting in a tunnel with nowhere for its enemies to move but ahead of it, the deep bulette gains the following abilities based on the escalation die.

abilities.name: Escalation die is odd
abilities.effect: When the bulette hits an enemy engaged with it with an attack, that target pops free from it and is hampered (save ends).

abilities.name: Escalation die is even
abilities.effect: The deep bulette engages each nearby enemy in front of it as it pushes its bulk inexorably forward down the tunnel.  Enemies pushed ahead of it this way don’t get to make opportunity attacks.

extraEffects.effect: The target pops free from all enemies engaged with it and is vulnerable to all attacks (save ends).
The green bulette gains a +3 bonus to attack and damage with its first attack each battle.

abilities.name: Into the earth
abilities.effect: The first time each round an attack hits the bulette, it can choose to hunker down as a free action.  If it does, it gains a +3 bonus to AC and PD until the start of its next turn.  Force attacks and opporunity attacks don’t trigger this ability.  If the green bulette hunkers down while it’s moving (for example, from a readied action), its movement ends that turn.

abilities.name: Blood-frenzy escalator
abilities.effect: While at least one creature in the battle is staggered or unconscious, the bulette gains a bonnus to its attacks and damage equal to the escalation die but can’t use into the earth. Ceatures that have no blood (constructs, oozes, plant creatures, etc.) don’t trigger this ability.

abilities.name: Occasional burrower
abilities.effect: Like all bulettes, the green bulette can burrow.  While above ground, it prefers to move slowly on the surface and rely on its plant- and soil-covered shell to stay hidden until it attacks.

extraEffects.effect: The target pops free from all enemies engaged with it, is pulled into the pit with the dirt-fisher (who engages it), and loses its next move action.  Climbing out of the pit requires a move action and a DC 20 check.  It the bulette is not in its pit, the bulette pulls the target to itself and engages it.

abilities.name: Hole digger
abilities.effect: A dirt-fisher can burrow incredibly quickly for short distances, but it prefers to attack from within its pre-dug trap-door pit.  It usually has a few pits dug nearby if forced to leave its current pit.

abilities.name: Into the earth
abilities.effect: The first time each round an attack hits the dirt-fisher, it can hunker down and pull the lid on its pit shut.  If it does, it gains a +3 bonus to all defences until the start of its next turn, and any creature in the pit takes a -5 penalty to checks to climb out of the pit.  Force attacks and opportunity attacks don’t trigger this ability.

abilities.name: Nowhere to run
abilities.effect: The dist-fisher deals double damage against creatures engaged with it in its pit.

extraEffects.effect: The target takes 10 thunder damage.

abilities.name: Blood-frenzy escalator
abilities.effect: While at least one creature in the battle is staggered or unconscious, the bulette gains a bonus to its attacks and damage equal to the escalation die.  Creatures that have no blood (constructs, oozes, plant creatures, etc.) don’t trigger this ability.

abilities.name: Earth surge
abilities.effect: Whenever the bumoorah takes damage from an attack, it rolls a save; on a 16+ it can immediately dive beneath the ground, preventing further attacks against it until it surfaces at the start of its next turn.  Force attacks and opportunity attacks don’t trigger this ability.

abilities.name: Serious burrower
abilities.effect: The bumoorah can burrow incredibly quickly for short distances.  Bumoorahs are renowned for the dust-spurts and vibrating sound they generate as they shoot through the ground like hungry spears.

extraEffects.effect: If the centaur champion scores a crit against the target, it can challenge that enemy.  If it does, until the end of the battle the champion and the target each take a -4 attack penalty against any target except the other.  If the centaur champion dies or challenges a new for, the old challenge is cancelled.

attacks.name: Crushing hooves
attacks.damage: 13 damage, and the target is vulnerable until the start of its next turn

abilities.name: Hooves and slash
abilities.effect: As a standard action, the centaur champion can make a crushing hooves attack and a single two-handed sword attack (one attack roll) against the same enemy.

abilities.name: Leader of the clan
abilities.effect: When the centaur champion engages an enemy, each other centaur ally engaged with that creature can pop free from it.

abilities.name: Moving combatant
abilities.effect: The centaur champion gains +4 AC bonus against opportunity attacks and only takes half damage from opportunity attacks that hit it.  When an enemy makes an opportunity attack against it and misses, that enemy takes 20 damage from a counter-attack.

nastierSpecials.name: Chief’s challenge
nastierSpecials.effect: When the champion issues a champion’s challenge, it only takes a -2 attack penalty against other enemies than its chosen for, but that enemy still takes the -4 attack penalty. In addition, the champion can use champion’s challenge as a free action when it becomes staggered.

nastierSpecials.name: Champion’s scorn
nastierSpecials.effect: Each of the champion’s centaur allies in the battle gains a +5 damage bonus with ranged attacks.

attacks.name: Charging lance
attacks.damage: 15 damage, and the target pops free from the centaur

extraEffects.effect: The crit range of the attack expands by 2 and instead deals 20 damage on a hit if the centaur first moves before attacking an enemy it wasn’t engaged with at the start of its turn.
The target is also dazed until the end of its next turn.
The centaur lancer can make a kick attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Kick
attacks.damage: The target takes 5 damage and pops free from the centaur

abilities.name: Harnessed speed
abilities.effect: The centaur lancer gains a +4 AC bonus against opportunity attacks.

extraEffects.effect: As a free action, the centaur raider can move and make another hoof and weapon attack against a different nearby enemy (it will take oppotunity attacks for moving).
The centaur raider can take an additional move action this turn.

attacks.name: Sweeping blow
attacks.damage: 15 damage, and the target loses its next move action

abilities.name: Harnessed speed
abilities.effect: The centaur raider gains a +4 AC bonus against opportunity attacks and only takes half damage from opportunity attacks that hit it.

nastierSpecials.name: Barreling charge
nastierSpecials.effect: When the escalation die is even, the centaur raider can use a standard action and a move action to make a sweeping blow attack against multiple enemies as it moves past them (it will take opportunity attacks). It ends this move and attack unengaged.

extraEffects.effect: The centaur ranger can take an additional move action this turn.
The centaur ranger can make a second (but not a third) longbow attack this turn as a free action.

attacks.damage: 8 damage, and the target is hampered until the end of its next turn

extraEffects.effect: The target is stuck (save ends) instead of hampered.

abilities.name: Terrain familiarity
abilities.effect: Once each round when the escalation die is odd, the centaur ranger can make use of the area’s terrain to its advantage as a free action.  It can choose either to gain a +2 attack bonus for its attacks that turn, or to gain a +2 bonus to all defences against the next attack that targets it by using a flashy or tricky maneouver (leaping off a rock over an enemy, stirring up a hornet’s next near an attacker, etc.).  The target of its attack or a creature attacing it when it attempts this stunt rolls a normal save; on a success, the bonus is negated.

nastierSpecials.name: Pinning volley
nastierSpecials.effect: The centaur ranger gains the pinning volley power.

extraEffects.effect: 7 damage, and the chaos beast can make another bestial chaos attack as a free action.
15 ongoing damage.

abilities.name: Chaos combined
abilities.effect: Once a chaos beast is staggered, it can combine with another chaos beast next to it as a quick action to become a full-strength chaos brute acting on this beast’s initiative.  Replace the other beast with a chaos glorp mook.

attacks.damage: Damage and effect depends on the natural roll

extraEffects.effect: 30 damage, and the chaos behemoth can make a mewhowlwail attack as a free action.
25 ongoing damage.
10 damage, and the target is hampered until the end of its next turn.

attacks.name: Mewhowlwail

At the GM’s option, a creature slain in a battle involving a chaos behemoth might transform into a chaos glorp or chaos beast instead of having the decency to just die.

attacks.name: Brute chaos
attacks.damage: Damage and effect depends on the natural roll

extraEffects.effect: 25 damage.
15 ongoing damage.
1d3 random nearby enemies each take 10 psychic damage.

abilities.name: Chaos combined
abilities.effect:
Once a chaos brute is staggered, it can combine with another chaos brute or chaos beast* next to it as a quick action to become a full-strength chaos behemoth: the new creature rolls initiative as if it had just entered the battle.
 If a chaos beast and a chaos brute combine to create a chaos behemoth, the behemoth starts with 70 hp instead of 90 hp and takes a -1 penalty to all attacks and defences.

attacks.name: Oozespasm

nastierSpecials.name: Now it’s angry
nastierSpecials.effect: When an attacker scores a critical hit against the chimera and it survives, its attack rolls on its next turn deal the effects of the lower rolls as well as their own results; for example, a roll 18-20 would daze the target and deal 20 ongoing damage as well as triggering fiery breath.

abilities.name: Chimerical change
abilities.effect: At the start of the battle each PC rolls one icon relationship die of their choice and one die chosen from their relationships by the GM.  A roll of 6 means the chimera has shifted in a manner that gives it a chimerical flaw (F) that the adventurers can exploit.  A roll of a 5 indicates that the chimera gains both a flaw and a benefit associated with that icon.  A result of 1 or 2 means that the chimera gains the icon’s chimerical benefit (B) without the flaw.  Actual benefits and flaws are up to the GM, and should reflect the icons with which the players have relationships.

abilities.name: Archmage
abilities.effect:
(B) Bearded spell-eating head: When a spell attack misses the chimera, it has no miss effect and the chimera heals 40 hp.
 (F) Vulnerability, melee: The crit range of melee attacks against the chimera expands by 2.

abilities.name: Crusader
abilities.effect:
(B) Skin of indomitable faces: When the chimera saves against a condition, it becomes immune to that condition until the end of the battle.
 (F) Vulnerability, spells: The crit range of spell attacks against the chimera expands by 2.

abilities.name: Diabolist
abilities.effect:
(B) Flaming oil glands: When a creature is engaged with the chimera at the start of its turn, it takes 20 fire damage.
 (F) Overconfident predator: Each time the chimera scores a critical hit, it takes a cumulative -2 penalty to all defences.

abilities.name: Dwarf King
abilities.effect:
(B) Stone-studded dermis: Any damage dice that roll maximum damage against the chimera count as 1s.
 (F) Stubborn beast: The chimera won’t willingly disengage from a creature engaged with it.

abilities.name: Elf Queen
abilities.effect:
(B) Springing stag legs: When the escalation die is odd, the chimera gains an additional standard action that turn.
 (F) Overly gracile: The chimera’s form is unusually frail, and any damage dice that roll 1s against the chimera count as 2s.

abilities.name: Emperor
abilities.effect:
(B) Mane of scorpion tails: The chimera has a fear aura: Enemies engaged with the chimear who are below 48 hit points are dazed and can’t use the escalation die.
 (F) Golden fleece: The chimera has transformed itself into a form that’s gem encrusted with golden fur. When slain it will yield 1d6 × 100 gp per adventurer in gems and precious metals. At the GM’s say-so, knowledge of this bounty may grant particularly mercenary characters a +1 attack bonus against the chimera once it’s staggered.

abilities.name: Great Gold Wyrm
abilities.effect:
(B) Inferno belly: When the chimera makes a fiery breath attack, it can make another fiery breath attack that turn as a quick action.
 (F) Flammable blood: When the chimera rolls a natural odd miss with fiery breath, it takes 20 fire damage.

abilities.name: High Druid
abilities.effect:
(B) Wild heart: The chimera is constantly evolving and changing. When an enemy rolls a natural 1-5 on an attack roll against it, the chimera adds the escalation die to its attack rolls until the end of its next turn.
 (F) Vilnerability, poison: The crit range of poison attacks against the chimera expands by 2.

abilities.name: Lich King
abilities.effect:
(B) Bone plates: When an enemy rolls a natural even miss with a melee attack against the chimera, the weapon temporarily loses all its bonuses and powers and the wielder is weakened (save ends both).
 (F) Vulnerability, holy: The crit range of holy attacks against the chimera expands by 2.

abilities.name: Orc Lord
abilities.effect:
(B) Mighty tusks: As a standard action, the chimera can make a tusk charge attack. It can’t make any other attacks the same turn.
 (F) Too many horns: The horns and tusks of the chimera lock together at inopportune moments. When it rolls a natural 1-5 with an attack against multiple targets, it loses any further attacks that turn.

abilities.name: Priestess
abilities.effect:
(B) Eagle wings: The chimera can fly like an eagle, swooping in and out of the battle.
 (F) Vulnerability, negative energy: The crit range of negative energy attacks against the chimera expands by 2.

abilities.name: Prince of Shadows
abilities.effect:
(B) Poison fangs: When the chimera rolls a natural 1-5 with an attack and misses, the target takes 20 ongoing poison damage.
 (F) Bickering heads: The first time each turn the chimera hits with an attack, it rerolls the attack and takes the lower roll.

abilities.name: The Three
abilities.effect:
(B) Draconic sinews: While not staggered, the chimera rolls 2d20 with its melee attacks and uses the higher roll.
 (F) Too many wings: Whenever the chimera moves, it rolls an easy save (6+). On a failure, it provokes opportunity attacks from each nearby enemy.

traits.name: Crusader
traits.description: The couatl gains a +1 bonus to AC and PD.  In addition, all the couatl’s melee attacks deal half damage when they miss.

traits.name: Diabolist
traits.description: Roll a d6 and a d8 on the Demon Ability table. If you get the same result, reroll the d8 until you have two different demonic abilities for the couatl.

traits.name: Dwarf King
traits.description: Secretly roll a d6 at the start of each battle.  If the roll is odd, the PCs can’t use any of their magic items’ powers when the escalation die is odd this battle.  If the roll is even, the PCs can’t use their magic items’ powers when the escalation die is even this battle.  Defauly chakra bonuses still function, but powers don’t.  And for the fun of it, once they’ve been powered off for a turn, all the PCs’ magic items will be freaking out and creating roleplaying havoc by forcing their quirks to the forefront for the rest of the battle.

traits.name: Elf Queen
traits.description:
At the start of each battle, the couatl gains 1d4 powers of its choice from this list:
  • Cruel: Once per battle, deal ongoing damage to a target you hit with a natural even attack roll as a free action. The ongoing damage equals 5 times your level. As usual, a normal save (11+) ends the damage. A critical hit doesn’t double this ongoing damage.
  • Highblood Teleport: Once per battle as a move action, place yourself in a nearby location you can see.
  • Elven Grace: At the start of each of your turns, roll a die to see if you get an extra standard action. If your roll is equal to or lower than the escalation die, you get an extra standard action that turn. At the start of the battle, you roll a d6. Each time you successfully gain an extra action, the size of the die you roll increases by one step on the following progression: (d4), d6, d8, d10, d12, d20. If you get an extra action after rolling a d20, you can’t get any more extra actions that battle.
  • Surprising: Once per batte, subtract one from the natural result of one of your own d20 rolls.

traits.name: Emperor

traits.name: Great Gold Wyrm

 Miss: Half damage.

attacks.damage: 30 damage, and 30 ongoing damage; while the target is taking ongoing damage, it is hampered

extraEffects.effect: 1/battle, when the escalation die is 4+.

abilities.name: Predation
abilities.effect: Creatures hit by the vrock’s demonic screech attack that are already vulnerable are also hampered (save ends).

extraEffects.effect:
The demon can grab the target as long as it isn’t already grabbing a creature. The grabbed foe can’t move except to teleport, pop free, or attempt to disengage, and disengage attempts take a -5 penalty unless the creature hit the glabrezou with an attack that turn.
 The glabrezou gains a +4 attack bonus against any enemy it is grabbing.

attacks.name: Painbolt
attacks.target: one nearby or far away creature

attacks.name: Hellfire
attacks.target: 1d3 nearby enemies in a group and any glabrezou allies engaged with those enemies

abilities.name: Mirror images
abilities.effect: At will, as a move action, a glabrezou can create multiple images of itself that make it harder to target.  The next time an attack would hit the glabrezou, the attacker has to roll 11+ with another d20 roll: success indicates a hit; failure is a miss that hits one of the mirror images instead, dealing no miss damage to the glabrezou but dispelling all the images.

abilities.name: Mirror images whilst staggered
abilities.effect: Once the glabrezou is staggered, it takes 2d10 damage whenever it uses mirror image, so movement or escape start registering as alternatives.

abilities.name: Power word stun
abilities.effect: Once per day as a free action, the glabrezou can utter a word of power, canceling a single action just taken by a nearby creature with fewer hit points than the glabrezou - whether it was casting a spell, healing an ally, or whatever. The GM can see the results of the action, such as a die roll, before deciding whether to use the power word.

extraEffects.effect:
The demon can grab the target if it isn’t already grabbing a creature. The grabbed foe can’t move except to teleport, pop free, or attempt to disengage, and disengage attempts take a -5 penalty unless the creature hit the hezrou with an attack that turn.
 The hezrou gains a +4 attack bonus against any enemy it is grabbing.

abilities.name: Demonic stench
abilities.effect: While engaged with this creature, enemies with 84hp or fewer are dazed (-4 attack) and do not add the escalation die to their attacks.

nastierSpecials.name: Abyssal sergeant
nastierSpecials.effect: Lower-level non-mook demons nearby the hezrou deal damage equal to their level when they miss with an attack.

nastierSpecials.name: Stab this now
nastierSpecials.effect: The hezrou’s allies gain a +4 attack bonus against any creature it is grabbing.

extraEffects.effect: The hooked demon can make another hooks and barbs attack as a free action (and yes, this can keep going up to a maximum number of attacks equal to the escalation die + 1).

nastierSpecials.name: Bleeding wounds
nastierSpecials.effect: Whenever the hooked demon hits a creature with hooks and barbs, that creature takes 10 damage each time it makes a non-basic attack (save ends).

attacks.name: Blight jet
attacks.damage: 7 damage, and the target is dazed (save ends)

extraEffects.effect: The imp can choose one: the target is weakened instead of dazed; OR the imp can make a blight jet attack against a different target as a free action.

abilities.name: Curse aura
abilities.effect: Whenever a creature attacks the imp and rolls a natural 1-5, that creature takes 1d10 psychic damage.

attacks.name: Six whirling swords
attacks.damage: 30 damage, and the marilith can pop free from the target after the attacks

attacks.name: Beguiling gaze
attacks.target: one nearby or far away unengaged enemy
attacks.damage: As a free action, the target immediately moves toward the marilith, attempting to engage it or get as close as possible to it

extraEffects.effect: 1/round, as a quick action.

abilities.name: Terrible swift swords
abilities.effect: The marilith’s crit range with melee attacks expands by a number equal to the escalation die.

extraEffects.effect: The nalfeshnee gains a +4 attack bonus until it hits.  Unlike most effects, let it stack.

attacks.name: Accursed burst
attacks.damage: 50 cold/fire/lightning/negative energy damage (your choice), and the nalfeshnee can make an abyssal curse attack as a free action

attacks.name: Abyssal curse
attacks.damage: The target is weakened until the end of its next turn

abilities.name: Unpredictable
abilities.effect: Nalfeshnee always have at least two random demon abilities.

nastierSpecials.name: Hooked mooks
nastierSpecials.effect: Once per battle, if the nalfeshnee is staggered, it can gat in 2d4 hooked demons as a quick action.  Roll initiative for the hooked demons; they do not appear in the battle and take their turns until their next initiative count comes up.

extraEffects.effect: 3d10 poison damage.
One special dybbuk ability triggers as a free action (see below).

attacks.name: Visage of innocence
attacks.damage: The target can’t attack the dybbuk until the end of its next turn

abilities.name: Shapechange
abilities.effect: As a standard action, the dybbuk can change its host’s form to that of another humanoid, or back to its own shape.  Seeing through the shapechange requires a DC 25 skill check.  When the dybbuk is driven out of the host body, the body reverts to its original form.

abilities.name: Unholy aversion
abilities.effect: When an enemy makes a spell attack or magic weapon attack against the parasitic dybbuk that deals holy damage and rolls a natural 18+, the dybbuk leaves the host body.  The body drops in place (unconscious) and the parasitic dybbuk becomes an undamaged ethereal dybbuk (see that entry).  If the escalation die is 3+, reset the escalation die to 2.

abilities.name: Wall-crawler
abilities.effect: A dybbuk can climb on ceilings and walls as easily as it moves on the ground.

abilities.name: Special Dybbuk Abilities
abilities.effect: Choose ONE of visage of innocence, horrific visage, or puppet strings.

abilities.name: Scratching nails
abilities.effect: When the target is engaged with the dybbuk at the start of its turn, it takes 20 damage.

abilities.name: Warped flesh
abilities.effect: The dybbuk heals 30 hp.

nastierSpecials.name: Experienced possessor
nastierSpecials.effect: When the dybbuk rolls a natural odd hit or miss with unearthly glare, one special dybbuk ability triggers.

nastierSpecials.name: Flight
nastierSpecials.effect: The dybbuk can hover 6 feet off the ground and make boneless flea-like leaps.

extraEffects.effect: The vrock can make a demonic screech attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Demonic screech
attacks.damage: 5 psychic damage, and the target is vulnerable (attacks vs. it have crit range expanded by 2) until the end of the battle

nastierSpecials.name: Predation
nastierSpecials.effect: Creatures hit by the vrock’s demonic screech attack that are already vulnerable are also hampered (save ends).

extraEffects.effect: The derro can cast one of the following close-quarters spells as a quick action this turn.
All nearby derro gain a +1 bonus to attacks and defences until the end of the derro maniac’s next turn (cumulative).
Two random nearby non-derro creatures take 2d4 thunder damage.
The target also takes 5 ongoing poison damage
As above, and the derro maniac can make another light repeating crossbow attack as a free action.
The derro can cast one of the following close-quarters spells as a quick action this turn.
All nearby derro gain a +1 bonus to attacks and defences until end of the derro sage’s next turn (cumulative).
Two random nearby non-derro creatures take 2d8 thunder damage.

attacks.name: Mind scream
attacks.damage: 12 psychic damage, and the target is confused (make a basic or at-will attack vs. ally) until the end of the derro sage’s next turn

extraEffects.effect: The derro sage can make another mind scream attack against a different nearby target as a free action.

nastierSpecials.name: Group gibbering
nastierSpecials.effect: The derro sage starts a group of derro gibbering as a quick action.  It can maintain the gibber as a free action at the start of each turn by taking 1 damage.  Each nearby non-derro creature that hears the gibber must roll a d6 at the start of its turn and takes psychic damage equal to the die roll or to the number of gibbering derro, whichever is lower.

traits.name: 1: Alternative element
traits.description: Change the resist fire 13+ ability to a different element, e.g. lightning or acid.

traits.name: 2: Beast form
traits.description: This rare special ability lets a devil pass unnoticed through populated areas, though with a tell-tale sign that it’s preternatural, such as a big cat that looks normal except for its forked tongue.  Changing forms is a move action.

traits.name: 3: Devilish resilience
traits.description: The devil gains a +4 bonus to saves.

traits.name: 4: Fear
traits.description: The devil gains fear aura.  Players with fewer hit points than double the devil’s current hit points are dazed.  They cannot use the escalation die.

traits.name: 5: Final-gasp strike
traits.description: When the devil drops to 0 hp, it stays up until its turn, at which point it can take one last standard action before dropping.  The devil will drop without getting that last action if it takes enough damage to reduce its hit points to negative 25% of its starting hp.

traits.name: 6: Humanoid form
traits.description: This rare special ability lets the heroes meet a pit fiend over dinner and not know it until too late.  Changing forms is usually a move action.

traits.name: 7: Resist non-damage effects
traits.description: The devil resists the effects (but not the damage) of attacks with a natural roll of 12 or less.  Ongoing damage isn’t affected by this ability.  If the attack deals energy damage that the devil is resistant to (like fire), that damage is halved as normal.  This ability is tied to a devil’s energy resistance number, so if you increase that number for a devil with this ability, the non-damage range also increases.

traits.name: 8: Summon other devils
traits.description: This ability is better used as a conditional feature of a particular battle than as a standard special ability.  On the first round of battle, a group of devils keens eerily, and everyone knows they’re summoning something, but no one knows exactly what, or when it will show up.

traits.name: 9: True seeing, see invisible
traits.description: Powerful deveils might have the ability to see through simple ruses and illusions.

traits.name: 10: Unearthly toughness
traits.description: If a devil takes X damage or less, negate that damage.  Bigger blows have full effect, but petty blows are beneath the devil’s notice.  Set X at the devil’s level + 1.  It will be immune to normal miss damage from enemies that are its level or lower.  Or set X at 5% of its starting hit points to have the value scale up faster at higher levels.

extraEffects.effect: The barded devil can make a whirling barbs attack as a free action.
6 damage.
The target also takes 20 poison damage and is hampered until the end of its next turn as it chokes on sulphurous fumes.

abilities.name: Barbs everywhere
abilities.effect: When an enemy engages the devil, the barbed devil can make a whirling barbs attack against it as a free action.

abilities.name: Devil’s due (Loot)
abilities.effect: When you choose to add the escalation die to an attack against a barbed devil, you must expend one of your unused true magic item powers as the item gets a close encounter with the barbed devil’s “soul”.  If you can’t expend such a power, no escalation die for you.

abilities.name: Slashing dodge
abilities.effect: While engaged with a single enemy, the barbed devil can “take 11” on a disengage check, taking a natural result of 11 instead of rolling. When it does so and successfully disengages, it can make a whirling barbs attack against that enemy as part of the move action.

abilities.name: Resist fire 13+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

extraEffects.effect: The bearded devil gains a +4 bonus to all defences until the start of its next turn.

attacks.name: Supernaturally filthy beard
attacks.damage: The target is weakened until the end of its next turn (-4 attacks and defences)

abilities.name: Bearded defence
abilities.effect: When an enemy engaged with the bearded devil misses it with an attack, the devil can make a filthy beard attack against that enemy as a free action.

abilities.name: Devil’s due (Solidity)
abilities.effect: When you choose to add the escalation die to an attack against a bearded devil, the devil or one of its nearby allies can roll a save against a save ends effect.

abilities.name: Opportunistic beard
abilities.effect: When the bearded devil makes an opportunity attack, it can also make a filthy beard attack against the same target as a free action.

abilities.name: Skilled interceptor
abilities.effect: A bearded devil can intercept an enemy while engaged with other enemies.  As a free action, it can either make a disengage check to try to move to intercept the enemy, or move to intercept the enemy and only take half damage from opportunity attacks.

abilities.name: Resist fire 13+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Toxic beard
nastierSpecials.effect: The target of the bearded devil’s filthy beard attack now takes 10 ongoing poison damage and is weakened (save ends both) instead.

attacks.name: Bone claw
attacks.damage: 80 damage, and the bone devil can make a doom venom sting attack as a free action

attacks.name: Doom venom sting
attacks.damage: 20 damage, and the target can’t use recoveries, even involuntarily (save ends)

abilities.name: Devil’s due (Free!)
abilities.effect: When you choose to add the escalation die to an attack against a bone devil, one bone devil in the battle can teleport to a nearby location it can see as a move action once later this battle.  Multiple attacks accumulate into multiple possible move action teleports for any bone devils in the battle.

abilities.name: Resist fire 13+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Mana venom
nastierSpecials.effect: The devil’s doom venom sting attack also negates one spell effect created by the target until the target is able to use recoveries again. (The effect isn’t cancelled, only suppressed until the target saves.)

extraEffects.effect: The target also takes 8 psychic damage and 8 ongoing psychic damage (that feels like a terminal case of guilt).
4 psychic damage.
The target takes 30 psychic damage instead.

abilities.name: Defence against the inconsequential
abilities.effect: Attacks against a fury devil take a -4 penalty unless the devil is hellbent against that attacker.

abilities.name: Devil’s due (Fury)
abilities.effect: When you choose to add the escalation die to an attack against a fury devil, the fury devil deals 1d10 extra damage with its next attack this battle, hit or miss.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: Fury devils fly from place to place but fight on their feet.

abilities.name: Menancing charge
abilities.effect: When an enemy intercepts the fury devil, the next attack this battle the devil makes against that enemy that hits is a critical hit instead.

abilities.name: Resist fire 13+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Hellbent
abilities.effect:
Fury devils become hellbent against a creature for story reasons outside the scope of a single battle. PCs could give devils ample reason to hate them. Or a succession of 5s as relationship dice with icon interactions that involve the devils might suffice to make the fury devil hellbent. More often than not, it won’t be one of the PCs who is the target, but getting in the way of hellbent furies is a problem. They will try to bypass defenders, however, to concentrate on killing their target or targets.
 Typically, a single fury devil leaves the Pit to exact retribution. If heroes manage to beat that erinyes back, then three new fury devils rise up to try to finish the mission that the first one failed at, and whoever killed the first erinyes is on their hit list, too. If those devils fail, five erinyes come next, with another hero added to their list. If stout-hearted heroes defeat all five fury devils, they’re safe. Maybe.

attacks.name: Needling taunt
attacks.damage: 8 psychic damage, and the target is hampered until the end of its next turn

attacks.name: Stinging tail
attacks.damage: 8 ongoing poison damage and the target is weakened (save ends both)

extraEffects.effect: As a free action, when an enemy engaged with the hell imp misses it with an attack.

abilities.name: Devil’s due (Mwahahahah!)
abilities.effect: When you choose to add the escalation die to an attack against a hell imp, the imp automatically hits with its next needling taunt attack this battle, and the target takes 2d6 extra psychic damage.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: Hell imps are capable of impressive feats of aerial agility, but only when their lives depend on it.

abilities.name: Resist fire 13+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Vanish
abilities.effect: Once per battle as a move action, a hell imp can become invisible, pop free from all enemies engaged with it, move away somewhere nearby, and then reappear.

abilities.name: Free-form ability - Provoke
abilities.effect: Hell imps are as capable as you might expect at handling social situations, sneaking, noticing spies, and the like.  Their special talent is provocation.  They can talk their associates into all sorts of extreme emotions and imprudent behaviour.  Likewise, they can probably goad PCs into losing their cool.

nastierSpecials.name: Potent venom
nastierSpecials.effect: The stinging tail attack deals 3 extra ongoing poison damage (11 total), but the target must succeed on two saves (one for ongoing and one for weakened).

extraEffects.trigger: The target has MD 15 or lower
extraEffects.effect: The honey devil can make a disengage check this turn as a free action.

abilities.name: Desperate plea
abilities.effect: When the honey devil is staggered by an attack, it makes a confusing plea attack against the attacker as a free action after the attack.

abilities.name: Glamour of innocence
abilities.effect: This creature seems innocent, not someone a hero should hurt.  At worst, it’s ugly, but is that a crime?  When an enemy rolls a natural odd attack roll against a honey devil, the attack misses and has no effect.

abilities.name: Resist fire 13+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Free-form covert ability - Slimy
abilities.effect:
In any non-combat struggles with a honey devil, it excels at being too slippery for the PCs, both personally and through its underground network of minions. In an indirect contest, the PCs might try to talk sense to one of the devil’s dupes or to discern suspicious activity while staking out the devil’s secret network. The honey devil is an expert at what it does, so use DC 25 for any such skill checks. Assume that the devil is competent at slipping its influence through the network unnoticed. Failure might mean that the PC has succeeded in gaining informaiton, which in turn sends them down a dead end or into a trap. In a direct confrontation, the devil is likewise hard to pin down, see through, or otherwise get the better of.
 A slime devil seems unremarkable and innocuous, so downplay its significance whenever describing it, especially when it has company. When mortals actually decide to attack or capture a honey devil, it’s probably slippery enough to escape at the last minute, maybe through a hidden exit.

extraEffects.effect: If this is the devil’s first attack during its turn, it can make a crushing punch or kick attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Telepathic harry
attacks.damage: The target takes 30 psychic damage each time it makes a non-basic attack (save ends).  The target silently hears a terribly hurtful statement, in the voice of the person who would hurt them the most by saying it.

extraEffects.effect: If this is the devil’s first attack during its turn, it can make a crushing punch or kick attack as a free action.

abilities.name: Devil’s due (Mastery)
abilities.effect: When you choose to add the escalation die to an attack against a hooded devil, it adds the escalation die to its attacks until the end of the battle and no other attacks against it can use the escalation die.

abilities.name: Resist fire 13+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Restoration
abilities.effect: At the start of a hooded devil’s turn, it can roll a save against each save ends effect affecting it if it doesn’t attack that turn (so it could successfully save against confused or stunned conditions and still move that turn, for example).

abilities.name: Free-form covert ability - Master
abilities.effect: A hooded devil instinctively masters everything around it: the furniture, terrain, conversations, and people.  If the PCs attempt to overcome a hooded devil through skill checks, the check is DC 30.  Good luck if you need to win an argument, get to an exit first, use terrain to your advantage, or pressure one of the devil’s thugs to rat it out.  The name of this ability is a verb.

attacks.name: Barbed fork
attacks.damage: 150 damage, and until the end of the battle against the target, the devil gains a +1 bonus to attacks and its crit range expands by 1 (cumulative)

extraEffects.effect: The horned devil can make a slicing tail attack against a different target as a free action.
The horned devil can make a slicing tail attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Slicing tail
attacks.damage: 35 ongoing damage from a bleeding wound

extraEffects.effect: The target also takes 30 ongoing fire damage.

abilities.name: Devil’s due (Weakness)
abilities.effect: When you choose to add the escalation die to an attack against a horned devil, you are weakened until the end of your next turn after you make the attack.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: Horned devils are clumsy but determined fliers.

abilities.name: Resist fire 13+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

extraEffects.effect: As a free action, one of the ice devil’s nearby allies of its level or lower can make a basic attack as the ice devil sets the battlefield.  That attack only deals half damage.
The target is stuck (save ends).
10 damage.

abilities.name: Devil’s due (Rime)
abilities.effect: When you choose to add the escalation die to an attack against an ice devil, you are stuck (save ends).

abilities.name: Shattering counsel
abilities.effect: When a lower level nearby ally of the ice devil attacks a creature that’s stuck, the crit range of that attack expands by the escalation die.

abilities.name: Resist cold 13+
abilities.effect: When a cold attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Devil’s due (Squirm)
abilities.effect: When you choose to add the escalation die to an attack against a lemure, another lemure in the mob somehow ends up in an unwanted place in the battle, though it’s hard to say how exactly.  They don’t seem to teleport, but there are so many of the things squirming around it just happens.

abilities.name: Living wave
abilities.effect: When three or more lemures engage an enemy, they can pick it up and move it along with them as they please without taking opportunity attacks.  The enemy getting moved around pops free of any other enemies engaged with it.

abilities.name: Nobody home
abilities.effect: When a lemure is targeted by an attack against MD, it ignores any effects of the attack and only takes damage from it.  In addition, lemures fight in a straightforward way, without tactics.  They never disengage willingly and they’re not coordinated enough to concentrate attacks on a vulnerable target.

abilities.name: Resist fire 13+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Free-form ability - Mass
abilities.effect: Heedless of each other’s safety or their own, lemures use sheer numbers to press through locked doors, climb walls, or dog pile on defenders.

nastierSpecials.name: Too dumb to die
nastierSpecials.effect: At the start of the lemure mob’s turn, roll a d6 for each lemure in the mob that’s dropped this battle.  For each 6, one of them reassembles its horrid self and stumbles back into the melee that turn (add 13 hit points to the mob’s hp total).  To make sure a downed lemure is truly dead, an attacker can spend an additional 7 damage of the total dealt to finish the job instead of carrying that damage over to another lemure in the mob.  Expending the right sort of limited-use power, such as a daily spell, might also keep a number of downed lemures totally dead.  Once the last member of the mob drops, stop rolling to see if lemures rise up.

attacks.name: Fiendish weapon
attacks.damage: 140 damage, and until the end of the battle the target takes a -2 penalty to attacks, defences, and level-based d20 rolls.  Hit points, feats, weapon damage, and other level-based benefits don’t change.  (The penalty isn’t cumulative).

extraEffects.effect: The pit fiend can make an entangling tail attack against a different target as a free action.
The pit fiend can use fiendish vigor as a free action.

attacks.name: Entangling tail
attacks.damage: 40 damage, and the target is hampered until the end of its next turn or until the pit fiend makes another entangling tail attack

attacks.name: Burst of hellfire
attacks.target: up to 3 nearby ot far away enemies in a group

extraEffects.effect: Half damage.

attacks.name: Black utterance of denial
attacks.target: each enemy engaged with the pit fiend
attacks.damage: The target is hampered until the end of its next turn

extraEffects.effect: 1/battle, as a quick action.

abilities.name: Devil’s due (Menace)
abilities.effect: When you choose to add the escalation die to an attack against a pit fiend, the escalation die does not increase at the start of the next round.  Special circumstances and PC powers can still increase it.

abilities.name: Fiendish vigor
abilities.effect: As a standard action, the pit fiend can heal 300 hp and roll a save against each ongoing effect on it. It can use fiendish vigor up to five times per battle.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: Amidst wind and flames, a pit fiend can fly with surprising agility.

abilities.name: Resist fire 13+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Cloak of fire
nastierSpecials.effect: When a creature is engaged with the pit fiend at the start of its turn, that creature takes 20 fire damage.

abilities.name: Stay whole
abilities.effect: At the start of its turn, a skin devil heals 8 hp.  If it doesn’t heal up to its maximum hit points, it loses its ability to heal from this ability until the end of the battle.

abilities.name: Structural collapse
abilities.effect: While the skin devil is staggered, when an enemy damages it, it loses and additional 4 hp as the hapless thing fails to hold its boneless, bulky mass together.

abilities.name: Free-form convert ability - Unnoticed
abilities.effect: The skin devil is routinely able to pass through civilised areas without alerting dogs, bouncers, city guards, or passersby.  If the thing attacks that’s when you notice that it’s not a human but a monstrous pile of flesh.  In addition to passing unnoticed in crowds, it uses its fluid shape to sneak through hidden places, and it doesn’t make much noise unless it wants to.  PCs looking for the devil won’t find it unless they have some special information or advantage, and even then it’s a hard check (DC 25).  Normally when PCs think they have the devil cornered, it escapes through a tight exit that it had previously identified.

extraEffects.effect: If the target is the only creature engaged with the smoke devil, the attack deals 30 poison damage instead.
7 poison damage.

attacks.name: Ember burst
attacks.target: each enemy engaged with the devil
attacks.damage: The target takes 5 fire damage for each creature hit by the smoke devil earlier in the battle (max 15 damage; remember to track this)

abilities.name: Ember of hate
abilities.effect: Each time the smoke devil hits an enemy, the embers floating in the centre of its body glow more brightly. Once per battle as a free action during its turn, the devil can make an ember burst attack. It also makes this attack as an interrupt action when it drops to 0 hp.

abilities.name: Devil’s due (Formless)
abilities.effect: When you choose to add the escalation die to an attack against a smoke devil, it gains resist damage 16+ against the attack.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: Smoke devils drift and eddy as if blown by an evil wind.

abilities.name: Resist fire 13+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 13+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Free-form covert ability - Insinuate
abilities.effect: Smoke devils have a preternatural ability to get to their chosen victims.  Keeping the smoke devil out is a hard, champion-tier challenge (DC 25).

nastierSpecials.name: Smokey retreat
nastierSpecials.effect: A smoke devil can “take 12” on disengage checks, taking a natural result of 12 instead of rolling (which normally would allow it to disengage automatically from up to two enemies).

traits.name: Escalator
traits.description: A dragon adds the escalation die to its attack rolls.

traits.name: Flight
traits.description: A dragon flies reasonably well, powerful and fast in a straight line though not as manoeuverable as more agile fliers.

groupTraits.name: Chromatic Dragon Ability (d8, d12, or d12 + 2)

traits.name: 1: True seeing
traits.description: The dragon is immune to invisibility and ignores any illusions.

traits.name: 2: Whipping tail
traits.description: When an enemy engaged with the dragon rolls a natural 1 or 2 with an attack roll, the dragon can make an opportunity attack against that creature as a free action.  The attack is set up by the dragon’s whipping tail but delivered by the dragon’s usual melee attack.

traits.name: 3: Tough hide
traits.description: The dragon has a +1 bonus to AC.

traits.name: 4: Twisted mind
traits.description: The dragon has a +2 bonus to MD.

traits.name: 5: Nimble
traits.description: The dragon has a +2 bonus to PD.

traits.name: 6: No vulnerability

traits.name: 7: Now I'm mad!

traits.name: 8: Serious threat

traits.name: 9: PC-style racial power

traits.name: 10: Raw power

traits.name: 11: Damage aura

traits.name: 12: More breath
traits.description: The dragon can use its intermittent breath 1d4 more times each battle.  If its breath weapon isn’t intermittent (white and green dragons), the dragon gains the extra uses anyway, making it more dangerous than lesser specimens of its colour.

traits.name: 13: Humanoid form

The haze is magical, semi-aware, and remains around the target until the end of the battle or until removed magically  A spell caster can cast a spell that targets AC or PD to attack the haze and destroy it - the haze has 1 HP and an AC/PD of 22.  The GM is encouraged to play fast and loose with physics here: the mist can be burned, condensed/frozen, blown away, absorbed, transmuted, etc.  At the GM’s discretion, there may be physical ways to remove the haze, bit should require a hard DC.

The empyrean dragon’s connection to the overworld falters, creating a storm of distorted time and magic in the area.  The dragon’s critical hit range for all attacks expands by 2 until the end of the battle.  In addition, when a target saves against the ongoing damage from this attack, the crit range of its attacks against the dragon expands by 1 until the end of the battle.
1/battle, as a free action when first staggered.

abilities.name: Three heads are better than one
abilities.effect: The empyrean dragon can make two gleaming bite attacks as a single standard action, one each from two heads. The third head is assumed to be manoeuvering the body around. It can choose not to make one of those attacks to end any condition affecting it except for ongoing damage (this includes the stunned condition, even though it technically doesn’t get an action when stunned). An enemy who scores a critical hit against an empyrean dragon can forgo the extra damage to lop off one of the dragon’s heads. If an enemy deals 150 damage with a single attack against the dragon, the attack will also remove a head. An empyrean dragon with two remaining heads can make only one gleaming bite attack as a standard action and can’t sacrifice that attack to remove conditions. The dragon dies if all three heads are removed.

traits.description: Each time the dragon drops to 0 hit points, it can roll a save.  The first save in a battle is easy (6+), the second normal, the third and subsequent saves are hard (16+).  If it succeeds, the dragon stays conscious and takes no damage from the attack or effect that would have dropped it.

traits.name: Nastier special
traits.description: Drow may optionally include one of these abilities as nastier specials: Drow Cruelty or Poisons and Potions.

traits.name: Drow Cruelty
traits.description: Choose an ability for all non-mook drow in a battle to have.

traits.name: Potions and Potions
traits.description: Drinking a potion, applying a poison, or using a substance requires only a quick action for a drow with one of these options.  Characters who acquire any of these drow items must use a standard action to drink/apply them.

traits.name: Poisoner
traits.description: When the drow scores a critical hit, it can forgo damage to force the target to start making last gasp saves.  On the fourth failure, the target falls unconscious (and can’t be woken normally) for 2d4 minutes.

traits.name: Take advantage of weakness
traits.description: Whenever an enemy nearby a drow rolls a save, it takes its level in damage.

traits.name: Umbral caul
traits.description: As long as at least one drow uses a standard action each round to maintain the supernatural darkness, each non-drow creature in the battle becomes dazed (save ends) whenever it rolls a natural 1-5 with an attack roll.

traits.name: Venomous
traits.description: The first time each battle a drow hits with a weapon attack, the target also takes 5 ongoing poison damage.

traits.name: Draft of Eschaton (potion)
traits.description: When drunk it immediately purges the body of all poisons and toxins and ends any ongoing conditions.  All the drinker’s saves (including last gasp saves and death saves) automatically succeed for the rest of the battle or for five minutes.  Immediately after the battle, the drinker must make a DC 30 Constitution check or be completely debilitated and unable to travel far or to fight for a day.

traits.name: Dragon Apples
traits.description: Small ceramic spheres that explode.  Make a basic ranged attack against a nearby enemy (or level + 5 for drow); on a hit, the target takes 10 ongoing fire damage.

traits.name: Midnight Tincture
traits.description: When this glass vial is broken, the nearby area is shrouded in clinging darkness.  The darkless lasts 3 rounds.  Each creature in the darkness except drow takes a -4 attack penalty.  The tincture can be attacked to an arrow or bolt.

traits.name: Potion of Spider Climbing
traits.description: For one battle or five minutes the drinker can climb on ceilings and walls as easily as it moves on the ground.

traits.name: Spider Venom
traits.description: A creature hit by a melee weapon coated in the venom takes 5 ongoing poison damage when the attack roll is a natural 16+.

traits.name: Web Dust
traits.description: Made from dessicated spiders, this dust can hold a door shut or stick an object to a wall for five minutes. Champion-tier creatures can make a DC 20 skill check to rip through something held by web dust before it fully dissolves, and epic-tier creatures can rip through such objects in a round. Further applications increase the effectiveness: three applications last for fifteen minutes, requires 3 successful checks, and takes 3 rounds for epic-tier characters to get through.

attacks.name: Glass-tipped lance
attacks.damage: 75 (90/25) daage, and the target pops free from the cavalry and is weakened (save ends)

extraEffects.effect: 1/battle, during a surprise round or the first round of battle.

abilities.name: Expert spider-rider
abilities.effect: While mounted, the drow cavalry deals +15 damage with its attacks, hit or miss, against unmounted enemies.

abilities.name: Mounted combatant
abilities.effect: Reduce the drow cavalry’s attack damage by 50 when it’s not riding a spider.

abilities.name: Spider mount
abilities.effect:
Whenever the drow cavalry rolls a natural 1-10 on an attack roll, its spider mount acts independently, choosing one of the following options
 Bite - The spide makes a bite attack.
 Jump & Scuttle - The spider and its rider pop free from all enemies and can move somewhere nearby.
 Web - The spider makes a web attack.

extraEffects.effect: 8 damage.

attacks.name: Exsanguinating barbed arrows
attacks.target: one nearby or far away enemy

extraEffects.effect: As a free action, the darkbolt can make a second barbed arrows attack against a different enemy with a -2 attack penalty. If it gets another natural even hit, it can make a third (and final) barbed arrows attack against a different enemy with a -4 attack penalty as a free action.

abilities.name: Darkbold vanish!
abilities.effect: If unengaged, when the darkbolt attacks and rolls a natural even miss, it can step into a shadow-dimension that turn as a move action.  While in the shadows, it can’t be seen or targeted with attacks, and it reappears anywhere nearby at the start of its next turn.

abilities.name: Wall-crawler
abilities.effect: A darkbolt can climb on ceilings and walls as easily as it moves on the ground thanks to its rope-dagger and spiked bracers.

nastierSpecials.name: Well equipped
nastierSpecials.effect: The drow has a potion or poison that it can use as a quick action twice this battle (see Drow Abilities).

abilities.name: Dark orison

abilities.name: Spider speaker

abilities.effect: At the start of each of the warped beast’s turns, roll a d6.  The warped beast gains the corresponding ability until the start of its next turn.

abilities.name: 1. Amorphous oozing form
abilities.effect: The beast has resist damage 11+ to all damage.

abilities.name: 2. Dimensional slide
abilities.effect: Once during its turn, the warped beast can teleport anywhere nearby it can see as a move action.  Each enemy engaged with it when it teleports is confused until the end of its next turn.

abilities.name: 3. Fear aura
abilities.effect: While engaged with the warped beast, enemies that have 24 hp or fewer are dazed (-4 attack) and do not add the escalation die to their attacks.

abilities.name: 4. Gibbering mouths
abilities.effect: When an enemy ends its turn engaged with the warped beast, it’s confused until the end of its next turn.

abilities.name: 5. Many spontaneous limbs
abilities.effect: When the warped beast makes a tentacle maw attack during its turn, roll a d4. That many additioinal limbs or tentacles spontaneously erupt from the creature and make an additional basic attack that turn (special abilities/effects don’t trigger on those extra attacks). Each of those attacks only deals half damage.

abilities.effect: When the warped beast hits a creature with a tentacle maw attack, the target also takes 5 ongoing psychic damage and a -2 penalty to saves (save ends both).
