traits.name: Some fungaloids can make special attacks.  For thsoe, add the fungaloid’s level to attacks and damage, as indicated
traits.description:
C: Poison tentacles 5 + level vs. PD (1d3 nearby enemies) - 3 + level poison damage, and the target is vulnerable to fungal attacks (save ends)
C: Brown noise 5 + level vs. PD (1d3 nearby enemies) - 3 + level ongoing thunder damage
C: Hallucinogenia 3 + level vs. MD (one nearby enemy) - The target is confused (easy save ends, 6+)
C: Infectious spores 5 + level vs. PD (1d3 nearby enemies) - 3 + level ongoing poison damage
C: Piercing shriek 5 + level vs. PD (1d3 nearby enemies) - 4 + level psychic damage

attacks.name: Stinging tendrils
attacks.damage: 4 poison damage, and the target is weakened until the end of its next turn

abilities.name: Puffball exploder
abilities.effect: The first time each round an aerial spore in the battle drops to 0 hp, it explodes and 1d3 nearby non-fungus non-construct creatures are covered in spores and begin to choke.  Until the end of the battle, when a choking creature rolls a natural 1-5 on an attack roll, it takes damage equal to the natural roll.  If a creature is affected twice by this attack, the damage it takes on a natural 1-5 doubles; if affected three times, it triples, etc..

abilities.name: Spores
abilities.effect: A creature choking from puffball exploder can use a standard action to wash the spores off itself and/or cough them up, preventing further choking effects until it’s affected by puffball exploder again.

abilities.name: Weightless
abilities.effect: The aerial spore floats upon air currents, but it prefers to stay within 5 to 7 feet of the ground so it can use its tendrils to keep it in place or propel it.  A free-floating spore too far away from the ground to use its tendrils can easily be blown about from strong winds or similar magical effects.

attacks.name: Focused brain blast
attacks.target: 1 nearby or far away staggered enemy

extraEffects.effect: 5 psychic damage.

attacks.name: Hallucinogenia
attacks.damage: The target is confused (easy save ends, 6+) and vulnerable to psychic damage until the end of the battle

extraEffects.effect: The target sees odd colours at the corners of its vision until it has taken a full heal-up (-2 penalty to skill checks to see things).

abilities.name: Programmed brain
abilities.effect: During its turn when one or more nearby enemies are staggered, the braincap uses focused brain blast. When no enemies are staggered, the braincap uses hallucinogenia if its hit points are even, and psionic filaments if its hit points are odd.

abilities.name: Lost opportunity
abilities.effect: This creature can’t make opportunity attacks.

abilities.name: Initiative
abilities.effect: Directly after the fungaloid empress in the initiative order

extraEffects.effect: The target is stuck until the end of its next turn.
Both the fungaloid and its target take 1d4 damge.

abilities.name: Food is here
abilities.effect: When a fungaloid creeper scores a critical hit with an attack, all nearby fungaloids move to engage the fungaloid’s target, even if that target has dropped to 0 hp.  The move is a free action, and engaged creepers can roll disengage attempts instead of taking opportunity attacks.

abilities.name: Slow, rolling wave
abilities.effect: Whenever the escalation die is even, each creeper must succeed on a normal save at the start of its turn or lose its move action that turn.

nastierSpecials.name: Fungal attack
nastierSpecials.effect: Make ONE fungal attack.

extraEffects.effect: The drudge can make a fungal attack this turn as a quick action.

abilities.name: Fungal attack
abilities.effect: Make ONE fungal attack.

abilities.name: Combat womb
abilities.effect: At the end of each of the empress’ turns, if there are fewer than two elder spores (see entry) per enemy, add a number of elder spores to the battle so that there are two spores per enemy.  A spore can “sprout” already engaged with a nearby or far away enemy on its own, it’s up to you.

abilities.name: Sporulating spiracles
abilities.effect: Fungus grows on everything in the area!  Whenever a non-fungus creature attempts to move, it must make a DC 18 Dexterity or Strength check to do so or it loses its move action.  If the creature uses a standard action to clear away fungus, it can move normally that turn.

extraEffects.effect: One nearby fungaloid can make a fungal attack as a free action.
Up to three nearby fungaloids can each make a fungal attack as a free action.
Up to five nearby fungaloids can each make a fungal attack as a free action.

abilities.name: Group mind
abilities.effect: The monarch’s attacks deal +1 damage for each other allied creature with the plant type in the battle (max +10).

abilities.name: Drudge-summons
abilities.effect: If there are not enough nearby fungaloids to use up all the fungal attacks granted by the mycotic sceptre, skip the extra fungal attacks but add a full-strength fungaloid drudge to the battle next to the fungaloid monarch.

extraEffects.effect: The sporrior can make a spore cloud attack this turn as a quick action.

attacks.name: Parasitic darts
attacks.target: 1d3 nearby or far away enemies in a group

extraEffects.effect: The sporrior can make a spore cloud attack this turn as a quick action.

abilities.name: Sprinter
abilities.effect: A sporrior gains an extra move action when the escalation die is odd.

abilities.name: Wall-crawler
abilities.effect: A sporrior can climb on ceilings and walls as easily as it moves on the ground.

extraEffects.effect: The gargoyle can make two more melee attacks as a free action (but never more than three total attacks per standard action, even if you roll another 11+).

nastierSpecials.name: Rocky hide
nastierSpecials.effect: The gargoyle has resist damage 12+ against attacks targeting AC.

nastierSpecials.name: Statues, statues, everywhere
nastierSpecials.effect: Because they often look like statues, gargoyles are capable of springing a surprise on inattentive PCs.  When there’s a chance of such an ambush, give the PCs a champion-tier skill check (DC 20) to notice the gargoyles and avoid being surprised.

traits.name: Flows where it likes
traits.description: The ooze is immune to opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Ooze
traits.description: The ooze is immune to effects.  When an attack applies a condition to an ooze (dazed, hampered, weakened, ongoing damage, etc.), that condition doesn’t affect it.

attacks.name: Shlup’n’schlorp
attacks.damage: 30 acid damage, and the cube engulfs the target (functions like a grab; see below) if it’s smaller than the cube

extraEffects.effect: The cube can make a spasms attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Spasms
attacks.target: up to 2 attacks, each against a different nearby enemy

abilities.name: Engulf and dissolve
abilities.effect:
Targets engulfed/grabbed by the cube take 30 acid damage at the start of the cube’s turn but are not viable targets for additional attacks by the cube. Multiple targets can be held within the cube simultaneously.
 Any engulfed creature that is also staggered must begin making last gasp saves or become paralysed as the cube’s toxins overwhelm it.

abilities.name: Instinctive actions
abilities.effect: Gelatinous creatures have no brains, sometimes they just do things. When the escalation die is odd, instead of making an attack or moving, roll a d6 to see what the cubahedron does. If an option is not viable (you roll a 5 but there is no engulfed enemy), reroll until you get a valid option.
The cubahedron jiggles in place.  Each nearby enemy takes 5 acid damage.  Each creature engulfed by the cube takes a -4 penalty to its saves until the end of its next turn.
The cubahedron moves as a quick action.  If the cube ends its move engaged with enemies, each of those enemies must roll a save; on a failure, the cubahedron grabs them (but they’re not engulfed).
The cubahedron spits an engulfed creature into the air above it and makes a shlup’n’schlorp attack against that creature with a +5 attack bonus. Then the creature is engulfed again.

The cubahedron flattens itself slightly and crawls up a wall and possibly across the ceiling. The cube fall at the end of its turn. Each creature engulfed by the cubes takes 30 damage, and it makes a gel drop attack against enemies below it.
Gel drop +10 vs. PD (1d3 nearby enemies) - 15 damage, and the cube engulfs the target if it’s smaller than the cube

The cubahedron moves one creature engulfed by it to the surface.  The target gains a +4 bonus to attempts to escape the cube, but each time the cube is targeted by an attack, the engulfed creature must roll a save; on a failure, it becomes the target of the attack instead.
The cubahedron spits out each enemy engulfed by it with great force in different directions; each of those creatures takes 50 damage.

attacks.name: Shlup’n’schlorp
attacks.damage: 30 acid damage, and the dodecahedron engulfs the target (functions like a grab; see below) if it’s smaller than the dodecahedron

extraEffects.effect: The cube can make a spasms attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Spasms
attacks.target: up to 2 attacks, each against a different nearby enemy

abilities.name: Engulf and dissolve
abilities.effect:
Targets engulfed/grabbed by the cube take 30 acid damage at the start of the cube’s turn but are not viable targets for additional attacks by the cube. Multiple targets can be held within the cube simultaneously.
 Any engulfed creature that is also staggered must begin making last gasp saves or become paralysed as the cube’s toxins overwhelm it.

abilities.name: Instinctive actions
abilities.effect: Gelationous creatures have no brains, sometimes they just do things. When the escalation die is odd, instead of making an attack or moving, roll a d12 to see what the dodecahedron does. If an option is not available (you roll a 1 but there are no nearby enemies), reroll until you get a valid option.

The dodecahedron makes a squash attack against 1d4 nearby enemies as it rolls and shlorps around the area. Any enemies already engulfed by the dodecahedron take 10 thunder damage.
C: Squash +10 vs. PD (1d4 nearby enemies) - 20 damage, and the target is stunned (easy save ends, 6+)

The dodecahedron throws out whip-like tendrils and makes a sudden orifice attack against each enemy engaged with it. Then it pulls each nearby enemy next to it and engages that creature.
Sudden orifice +12 vs. PD (each enemy engaged with it) - The dodecahedron engulfs the target it it’s smaller than the dodecahedron

Hundreds of finger-size slimes slither out from the interior of the dodecahedron and begin worming their way across the bodies of each of its enemies in the battle.  Until the end of the battle, when a non-ooze creature takes any damage besides ongoing acid damage, it also takes 10 acid damage.

The dodecahedron bounces and thrums.  Each enemy engaged with it or engulfed by it must roll a save; on a failure, that enemy takes 30 thunder damage.  On a success, it takes 15 thunder damage and pops free from the dodecahedron.

The dodecahedron hunkers down and produces acidic spikes.  It gains a +4 bonus to all defences until the end of the battle, and each enemy who makes a melee attack against it with a non-magical weapon must roll a save; on a failure the weapon dissolves.  When a creature’s weapon dissolves, that creature is hampered and weakened (save ends both).  Magical weapons lose their bonuses to hit and damage until the end of the battle instead of being dissolved (but the owner is still hampered and weakened).  They can be “restored” after the battle by taking a few minutes during a rest to re-attune them.

The dodecahedron moves, rolling around the battlefield, then makes a shlup’n’schlorp attack at the end its movement with a +5 bonus. If the attack misses, instead of making a spasms attack the dodecahedron rolls about the area again and makes a second shlup’n’schlorp attack with a +10 bonus. If the second attack misses, it doesn’t get a spasms attack and the dodecahedron’s turn ends.

The dodecahedron makes a spasms attack. If it misses with either attack roll, after the attacks, it can make a stretch and engulf attack as a free action.
C: Stretch and engulf +12 vs. PD (one nearby or far away enemy) - 30 acid damage, and the dodecahedron engulfs the target if it’s smaller than the dodecahedron

C: Pseudopod slaps +10 vs. AC (one nearby enemy) - 25 thunder damage
 Natural odd hit: The target pops free from the dodecahedron and is knocked far away, and the ooze makes the attack again against a different nearby enemy as a free action.
 Natural even hit: The dodecahedron engulfs the target if it’s smaller than the dodecahedron.
Each enemy engulfed by the dodecahedron takes 40 acid damge, and the dodecahedron heals 40 hp for each enemy it has engulfed.

The dodecahedron splits into an octahedron and a tetrahedron, and each one can act this turn (roll a d8 and d4 for the instinctive actions of each one). Divide the dodecahedron’s current hit points into thirds, and give on third to the tetrahedron and two thirds to the octahedron.

The dodecahedron splits into three tetrahedrons, and each one can act this turn (roll a d4 for the instinctive actions of each one). Divide the dodecahedron’s current hit points equally between the three new creatures.

The dodecahedron splits into two cubahedrons, and each one can act this turn (roll a d6 for the instinctive actions of each one). Divide the dodecahedron’s current hit points equally between the two new creatures.

attacks.name: Shlup’n’schlorp
attacks.damage: 38 acid damage, and the cube engulfs the target (functions like a grab; see below) it it’s smaller than the cube

extraEffects.effect: The cube can make a spasms attack as a free action.

attacks.target: up to 2 attacks, each against a different nearby enemy

abilities.name: Engulf and dissolve
abilities.effect:
Targets engulfed/grabbed by the cube take 38 acid damage at the start of the cube’s turn but are not viable targets for additional attacks by the cube. Multiple targets can be held within the cube simultaneously.
 Any engulfed creature that is also staggered must begin making last gasp saves or become paralysed as the cube’s toxins overwhelm it.

abilities.name: Instinctive actions
abilities.effect: Gelatinous creatures have no brains, sometimes they just do things. When the escalation die is odd, instead of making an attack or moving, roll a d8 to see what the octahedron does. If an option is not viable (you roll a 3 but there are no nearby targets), reroll until you get a valid option.

C: Acid splash +11 vs. PD (1d3 nearby or far away enemies in a group) - 8 ongoing acid damage
 Each failed save: Acid destroys one of the target’s non-magical items. The target takes a cumulative -1 attack penalty until the end of the battle (boots fall apart, shield straps snap, etc.).
 Miss: 5 ongoing acid damage.

The octahedron grows an orifice that gushes out a liquid glue that floods the area.  Each enemy engaged with the octahedron is stuck (hard save ends, 16+).  Each nearby enemy not engaged with the octahedron is stuck (save ends).  Each far away enemy is stuck (easy save ends, 6+).  The glue has no effect on creatures who are flying or that have some way of avoiding it.

The octahedron squirts a slick slime that targets 1d3 nearby enemies.  Until the end of the battle, each target must roll an easy save each time it moves; on a failure, it’s hampered until the end of its next turn.

On a success, until the end of the battle, the golem loses its damage resistance and becomes vulnerable to all attacks (against each enemy informed of the flaw).

abilities.name: Resist damage 18+
abilities.effect: When an attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 18+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Percussion resonance
nastierSpecials.effect: When the escalation die reaches 3+, the bronze golem gains a bonus to its first gong-like fists of bronze attack roll each turn equal to the number of attacks made against it so far that turn. (Each turn is separate, not cumulative.)

nastierSpecials.name: Spiky
nastierSpecials.effect: When an enemy engaged with the bronze golem misses it with a melee attack, that enemy takes 2d12 damage.

extraEffects.effect: A non-dwarf creature damaged by a clay golem can’t be healed to above half its maximum hit points until after the battle.

abilities.name: Golem immunity
abilities.effect: Non-organic golems are immune to effects.  They can’t be dazed, weakened, confused, made vulnerable, or touched by ongoing damage.  You can damage a golem, but that’s about it.

abilities.name: Ignore attacks 11+
abilities.effect: When an attack hits this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 11+ on the attack roll or it missed instead. That’s all attacks.

attacks.name: Maddened battlefield repairs
attacks.damage: 20 damage, and the flesh golem heals 2d10 hit points

extraEffects.effect: 10 damage, and the flesh golem heals 1d10 hit points.
The flesh golem can only use this attack while it’s staggered.

abilities.name: Energy magnet
abilities.effect: Whenever a spell causes cold, fire, force, lightning, or negative energy damage targets one of the flesh golem’s nearby allies, the flesh golem has a 50% chance of becoming the main target instead.  Therefore spells that affect groups would spread out from the flesh golem.

abilities.name: Weakness of the flesh
abilities.effect: Flesh golems are not immune to effects.

extraEffects.effect: 5d10 damage.

abilities.name: Golem immunity
abilities.effect: Non-organic golems are immune to effects.  They can’t be dazed, weakened, confused, made vulnerable, or touched by ongoing damage.  You can damage a golem, but that’s about it.

abilities.name: Rampage
abilities.effect: At the start of each of the iron golem’s turns, roll a d6. If the roll is equal to or less than the escalation die, the iron golem goes on a rampage that turn. Instead of its two normal fists of iron attacks, it can make three attacks with fists of iron, each against a different random nearby creature, enemy or ally. It can move after each such attack as a free action, if necessary, taking only half damage from opportunity attacks during the rampage.

nastierSpecials.name: Poison gas
nastierSpecials.effect: The first time the iron golem is staggered, poison gas leaks from it into the area. It can make a poison gas cloud attack as a free action.

extraEffects.effect: The golem can make a backswing attack as a free action.

abilities.name: Golem immunity
abilities.effect: Non-organic golems are immune to effects.  They can’t be dazed, weakened, confused, made vulnerable, or touched by ongoing damage.  You can damage a golem, but that’s about it.

abilities.name: Special virtues
abilities.effect: Each marble golem is infused with two virtues - magical properties that relate to the emotion or feeling incorporated into the sculpture as its dominant theme. Choose two virtues from the list below, or for a unique marble golem, invent your own.

abilities.name: Awe (fear effect)
abilities.effect: While nearby the golem, enemies with 40 hp or fewer are dazed (-4 attack) and do not add the escalation die to their attacks.

abilities.name: Beauty
abilities.effect: The first time each enemy attacks the marble golem this battle, it must roll a normal save; on a failure, the attack takes a -6 penalty.

abilities.name: Courage
abilities.effect: While staggered, the marble golem adds the escalation die to its attack rolls.

abilities.name: Endurance
abilities.effect: When the marble golem rolls a natural 1-5 with an attack roll, it heals 1d10 hit points per point on the escalation die.  (It was checking for damage and got distracted.)

abilities.name: Hatred
abilities.effect: When an enemy is staggered by the marble golem’s attack, that enemy takes 4d10 extra damage.

abilities.name: Patience
abilities.effect: Each turn, the marble golem can use one standard action to gain a +2 bonus to all defences until the start of its next turn.  If it does, it gains an extra standard action during its next turn.

abilities.name: Protection
abilities.effect: When the marble golem rolls a natural 16+ with an attack, decrease the escalation die by 1.

abilities.name: Strength
abilities.effect: The marble golem’s melee attacks now deal half damage on a miss.

nastierSpecials.name: More virtues
nastierSpecials.effect: Statues that capture even more themes make stronger marble golems.  Add one or two more virtues to the golem.

extraEffects.effect: 15 damage.

attacks.name: Finishing smash
attacks.damage: 80 damage, and the golem pops the target off it and moves it a short distance away from the golem

extraEffects.effect: 20 damage, and the target is hampered (save ends).
20 damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).

abilities.name: Golem immunity
abilities.effect: Non-organic golems are immune to effects.  They can’t be dazed, weakened, confused, made vulnerable, or touched by ongoing damage.  You can damage a golem, but that’s about it.

nastierSpecials.name: Former idol
nastierSpecials.effect: Evoke the powers of an ancient culture’s strange rites by giving the stone golem any weird power you wish. If you’re stuck for inspiration, consider starting with random abilities from the demons that aren’t related to energy or the cone of cold from the ogre mage.

traits.name: Abilities
traits.description: Hags get TWO of the following abilities.

traits.name: Death curse
traits.description:
When a hag dies she curses the one who killed her. The only known way to remove the curse is to seek the aid of another had, though there may be some ways to end such a curse that are not readily known.
 Create one curse per hag. A good curse makes life horribly weird for a character, but isn’t something that debilitates them. Avoid ones that blid, deafen, cripple, or mute characters. Odd habits, ugly features, unusual smells, strange and digusting giets - all these are good. They should make the character and the story more interesting.

traits.name: Adept Illusionist
traits.description:
The hag gains a +5 bonus to initiative checks due to being not quite where she seems.
Hag abilitiy: As a distraction, the hag creates an illusion of her doing one thing, when she is in fact setting a trap. The hag throws out a bear-trap or other impediment and one nearby enemy becomes stuck (save ends). While stuck this way, the target takes 6 damage at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Another skin
traits.description:
One the hag’s first round of combat each battle, she gains a +2 attack bonus due to her victims being shocked as she bursts out of her false outer skin.
Hag ability: The hag coughs up a glob of liquid pseudo-flesh that globs onto a nearby enemy (no attack roll). The glob solidifies causing an effect of the hag’s choice: the target is stuck (save ends); OR the target is unable to cast spells during its next turn (the pseudo-flesh covers their mouth and face).

traits.name: Blood pact
traits.description:
Each creature allied to the hag through a pact gains a +2 bonus with their first attack each battle if the hag is present.
Hag ability: The hag spits blood in the face of the target and makes a command. The target must roll an immediate save; on a failure, as a free action it makes basic attack against an ally or against itself (target’s choice).

traits.name: Breath stealing
traits.description:
The hag starts combat with 10 temporary hit points.
Hag ability: The hag steals a recovery from the target and heals 20 hp.

traits.name: Death shriek
traits.description:
When a melee attack hits the hag, she lets out a shriek as a free action and the attacker takes 2d4 thunder damage.
Hag ability: The hag begins to shriek, and each enemy in the battle takes a -4 attack penalty with spells until the start of her next turn.

traits.name: Dusk walk
traits.description:
Once per day the hag can implant a suggestion in the mind of a target sleeping within a day’s travel of her. The hag rolls an attack: +10 vs. MD; on a hit, she implants a suggestion in the target that they must obey when a condition she chooses is met. Suggested actions can’t cause direct harm (the target can’t be forced to fight another or harm themselves), can be no longer than 12 words, and affects the target for a week or until triggered. GM keeps the roll hidden.
Hag ability: The hag becomes immaterial, pops free from all enemies engaged with her, and enters the land of dreams re-appearing next to any nearby conscious creature (or a nearby or far away creature that is unconscious). The hag then makes the following attack: C: +10 vs. MD (eacn nearby unconscious enemy) - The hag implants a suggestion in the target that they must obey when they become conscious (unusually “When you awake, flee this fight and discard your equipment.”). Suggested actions can’t cause direct harm. The round after the target acts on the implanted suggestion it can start rolling normal saves to throw off the effect.

traits.name: Fateful visions
traits.description:
The hag uses a +2 magical weapon traded to her for her services (she gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage with melee attacks).
Hag ability: The had has seen this fight in a vision. Her crit range expands by 2 until the end of the battle. Each increase is cumulative.

traits.name: Foul-touched
traits.description:
When an enemy is battling the hag, at the start of each of its turns, it takes 2d6 psychic damage from the horror of the hag’s visage unless it takes precautions to avoid directly glancing at her terribly face (mirror, blindfold, etc., which might cause attack penalties).
Hag ability: The hag choose a nearby enemy and glares at it. That target must roll an immediate; on a failure the target is stricken blind by her ugliness. While blinded this way, the target is hampered, weakened, and can’t make ranged attacks. The target can end the effect by splashing liquid into their eyes or using a similar act to clear the ugly out as a standard action.

traits.name: Song of dreams
traits.description:
Enemies take a -4 penalty to their initiative rolls in battles with the hag.
Hag ability: The hag begins to sing and the two enemies closest to her (even if far away) must roll an immediate save; on a failure, the target is dazed (save ends). If the dazed target fails its first save, instead it’s weakened (save end). If the weakened target fails its second save, instead it’s helpless (save ends).

traits.name: Thief of mist
traits.description:
The hag ignores opportunity attacks and can’t be intercepted while moving.
Hag ability: The hag becomes a mist until the start of her next turn. While a mist, only spells cast with a +3 implement and attacks using a +3 magical weapon can harm her. (Some special story item might also allow attacks to hit of no PC has a +3 item.)

traits.name: Twist the path
traits.description:
Once per day the hag can enspell an area to attract visitors, causing those travelling nearby to get lost and wander to that location. Alternatively, the hag can cause the location to repel visitors. Finding the correct path to that location requires a DC 20 check if it is a familiar place, a DC 25 check if the travellers only have a map or guide, or a DC 30 check if the travellers are unfamiliar with the area.
Hag ability: The target is also confused (easy save ends, 6+).

traits.name: Weakening touch
traits.description:
Each enemy fighting the hag must roll a normal save at the start of the battle; on a failure, that creature starts the battle weakened (easy save ends, 6+).
Hag ability: The target is dazed (save ends). If the dazed target fails its first save, instead it’s weakened (save ends). When the target saves against this effect, it takes a -2 attack penalty until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Winter breath
traits.description:
The hag’s attacks deal cold damage.
Hag ability: The target takes 6 ongoing cold damage.

extraEffects.effect: The hag triggers on hag ability as a free action.
The hag triggers two hag abilities as a free action (can’t by the same ability twice).
The attack roll also targets a second different enemy of the hag’s choice (but a third with another 16+).
As above, and the attack roll also targets a third different enemy of the hag’s choice (but not a fourth with another 18+).

abilities.name: Death curse
abilities.effect: Each hag can lay a curse upon the one who ends its horrible life.  After dropping to 0 hit points, a hag always lingers long enough to pronounce the words of the curse.  (See Death Curses.)

abilities.name: Delusionist
abilities.effect: All hags have the ability to twist the perceptions of others.  If the hag has a short time to prepare, it can hide a small hut, disguise a volunteer or captive as a monster, disguise itself as a harmless peasant woman etc..  A DC 30 skill check is required to overcome the delusion and see the truth of it (if a player gives a reason for not trusting what their character sees; perhaps add subtle clues toward that end).  The magic fades as soon as the hag enters combat.

abilities.name: Fear
abilities.effect: While engaged with this creature, enemies with 30 hp or fewer are dazed (-4 attack) and do not add the escalation die to their attacks.

traits.name: Lethal swing
traits.description: Once per battle, a half-orc can reroll a melee attack and use the result it prefers.

extraEffects.effect: One nearby lower-level mook makes an attack as a free action.
The half-orc commander gains 20 temporary hit points.

abilities.name: Orcish command
abilities.effect: When a nearby ally of the half-orc commander scores a critical hit, that ally can roll a save against a save ends effect as a free action.

extraEffects.effect: The half-orc legionnaire gains a +2 bonus to all defences until the start of its next turn.
The target takes +1d6 damage.
4 damage.
If the legionnaire’s next melee attack is a natural even hit, it becomes a critical hit instead!

10 damage.

abilities.name: Tribal rage
abilities.effect: When the escalation die is even, a tribal champion can roll two d20 for each melee attack roll it makes and use the result it prefers.  If both dice are 11+, the melee attack is a critical hit.

extraEffects.effect: The harpy gains a +5 bonus to attack and damage with this attack against any enemy suffering from any fiendish song effect.
The target is hampered (easy save ends, 6+)

abilities.name: Telekinetic crush
abilities.effect: When the escalation die is even, one enemy of the skull’s choice that is stuck from its telekinetic grasp takes 18 force damage at the start of the skull’s turn. When the escalation die is odd, one such stuck enemy of its choice is hampered (save ends).

extraEffects.effect: The target is confused (easy save ends, 6+).

attacks.name: Smoldering flames
attacks.damage: 14 fire damage, and each time the target fails a save this battle, it bursts into flames and takes 5 ongoing fire damage

abilities.name: Limited flight

attacks.name: Puns
attacks.damage: 5 psychic damage, plus 1d6 ongoing psychic damage if the GM makes a horrible pun while rolling the attacks

abilities.name: Bad puns
abilities.effect: Creatures that can’t hear or that have attempted to reduce their hearing are only affected by a jest bones’ pun attack if the natural roll is odd.

abilities.name: Limited flight
abilities.effect: The haunted skull can glide and hover, always within seven or eight feet of the ground.  It also performs barrel rolls.

abilities.name: Lost opportunity
abilities.effect: This creature can’t make opportunity attacks.

attacks.name: Treacherous scream
attacks.target: up to 2 nearby or far away enemies
attacks.damage: 6 psychic damage, and the target takes 2d6 psychic damage the first time it succeeds at a save before the end of its next turn.

abilities.name: Limited flight

abilities.name: Lost opportunity

extraEffects.effect: 18 thunder damage to 1d3 nearby enemies (the beast screams and bellows in disappointment).
The target is stuck (save ends) from looking into the void within it.
1/battle.

abilities.name: Fear
abilities.effect: While engaged with this creature, enemies that have 60 hp or fewer are dazed (-4 attack) and do not add the escalation die to their attacks.

extraEffects.effect: The target takes 3 extra acid damage and is stuck (hard save ends, 16+).

abilities.name: Acidic
abilities.effect: When a creature is engaged with the slime-skull or stuck from its grasping slime tendrils attack at the start of its turn, it takes 3 acid damage.

abilities.name: Slimy blastback
abilities.effect: When an enemy engaged with the slime-skull hits it with a melee attack, the slime-skull fires a blast of acidic slime back at that creature, which takes 1d4 acid damage.

abilities.name: Slow
abilities.effect: This creature is slow.  It only moves when the escalation die is odd or 6+.

abilities.name: Wall-crawler
abilities.effect: A slime-skull can climb on ceilings and walls as easily as it moves on the ground.

nastierSpecials.name: Breeder
nastierSpecials.effect: If the slime-skull kills a creature, it takes that creature’s head as a standard action and attempts to escape (it can squeeze through gaps as small as the skull).  The slain creature can’t be resurrected until its skull is recovered because its spirit is now trapped within the skull.  If the PCs don’t track down the slime-skull before their next full heal-up (or within a day), the stolen skull will transform into another slime-skull.  Attempts to resurrect the creature become much more difficult, perhaps even impossible, at that point.

extraEffects.effect: The target is stuck (save ends).

extraEffects.trigger: Natural roll is equal to or lower than the escalation die
extraEffects.effect: 1d3 nearby enemies hear the alarm and join the battle.  The creatures attracted by the constant screeching are (usually) level 1 mooks of a type that would be appropriate for the skull’s location.

abilities.name: Immobile
abilities.effect: The skull can’t hop, jump, roll, or fly.  It can’t even move its jaw.

abilities.name: Lost opportunity
abilities.effect: This creature can’t make opportunity attacks.

nastierSpecials.name: Allies
nastierSpecials.effect: Creatures that have been mystically “keyed” to the skull aren’t affected by its screech attack.

nastierSpecials.name: Gem eyes
nastierSpecials.effect: The skull can sense the unseen and things from beyong the world. A wizard using a blur spell, a rogue shadow walking, and other similar abilities offer no protection from the skull and its screech attack. (If the PCs come up with a plausible tactic to bypass the skull, give the skull a normal save to detect them.)

nastierSpecials.name: Move-triggered
nastierSpecials.effect: When an enemy near the skull uses a move action to move, the skull can make a screech attack against that creature as a free action that interrupts the move. The skull can use this ability twice per round. Shadow walking, teleporting, and other non-standard modes of movement will trigger the screech attack.

extraEffects.effect: 2 damage.

When an enemy’s attack hits the boombug and leaves it staggered with an odd number of hit points, it explodes and dies. (Even hit points does nothing.) When it explodes, each nearby creature not engaged with it takes 1d4 thunder damage, and it makes a thunderous explosion attack against each creature engaged with it.
5 thunder damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Latches on
nastierSpecials.effect: When the boombug hits with gnawing teeth, the target takes a -5 penalty to disengage checks until it’s no longer engaged with the boombug.

extraEffects.effect: 5 ongoing acid damage (easy save ends, 6+), and the hellwasp can pop free from the target.

abilities.name: Virulent injection
abilities.effect: When a creature fails a save against the hellwasp’s ongoing acid damage, it gains a random condition until it saves against that damage.  Have the player roll a d4 to determine the condition: 1. confused; 2. weakened; 3. dazed; 4. vulnerable.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: Hellwasps are adroit fliers that can hover and even fly backward.

nastierSpecials.name: Lethal injection
nastierSpecials.effect: The save versus the stinger’s ongoing acid damage is a normal save (11+) instead of an easy save.

abilities.name: Spiky bits
abilities.effect: When a hook scuttler moves to engage an enemy it wasn’t engaged with at the start of its turn, that enemy takes 1d6 damage.  When an enemy tries to disengage from the hook scuttler and fails, it takes 1d6 damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Corpse eater
nastierSpecials.effect: When a nearby enemy drops to 0 hit points or below in the battle, the hook scuttler will ignore other enemies and move to attack that unconscious enemy until that enemy is dead.

extraEffects.effect: The swarming maw can teleport to engage a nearby enemy it can see that is already engaged by at least one other hellbug.
The first time each battle the serrated maw misses, the target takes 1d4 damage for each hellbug engaged with it.

nastierSpecials.name: Ongoing swarm
nastierSpecials.effect: The serrated maw also deals miss damage the second time it misses with a serrated maw attack each battle.

extraEffects.effect: The hellhound can make a fiery breath attack as a free action.

abilities.name: Resist fire 16+
abilities.effect: When a fire attack targets this creature, the attacker must roll a 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Fiery aura
nastierSpecials.effect: Each creature engaged with a hellhound at the start of its turn takes 2d6 fire damage.

extraEffects.effect: The sorcerer can target a different nearby enemy with the attack.

attacks.name: Major spell: Breath of the Blue
attacks.damage: 10 lightning damage, and at the start of the target’s next turn, 1d6 nearby allies of the target take 4 lightning damage

extraEffects.effect: The sorcerer gains one use of the target’s racial power, if any.  It must use that power by the end of the battle or lose it, and it can’t use the power this turn.

abilities.name: Power-monger
abilities.effect: When the blue sorcerer starts its turn and it didn't gather power the previous turn, choose whether it will gather power or cast a spell this turn. When it chooses to cast a spell, roll a d20 to see if it uses a minor spell or a major spell: 1-10: minor spell; 11-20: major spell.

abilities.name: Gather power
abilities.effect:
Like a PC sorceror, a blue sorcerer can use its standard action to gather power in order to cast a double-strength and double-damage spell with its next standard action. When it gathers power, the sorcerer rolls a d6 and gains one of the following chaotic benefits.
 1-2: The sorcerer gains a +1 bonus to AC and until the start of its next turn.
 3-4: One nearby enemy of the sorcerer’s choice takes damage equal to the sorcerer’s level (3).
 5-6: Each nearby enemy engaged with the sorcerer’s allies takes damage equal to the sorcerer’s level (3); OR grant one nearby dragon with intermittent breath an additional use of its breath weapon this battle.

nastierSpecials.name: Escalating caster
nastierSpecials.effect: Add the escalation die to the sorcerer’s power-monger rolls and attack rolls.

nastierSpecials.name: Sorcerous evasion (kobold sorcerers only)
nastierSpecials.effect: Once per battle when an attack misses the sorcerer, the attacker takes the miss damage from that attack, if any, and the sorcerer takes no damage.

attacks.name: Demon bow
attacks.damage: 15 damage, and the target is dazed (-4 attack) until it pulls the arrow out using a quick action, which deals 10 ongoing damage

extraEffects.effect: The demon bow eats at the ranger’s arm and the ranger takes 1d6 damage.

abilities.name: Bow teeth

abilities.name: Sprout sixth head

Using the hydra’s current hit points as a new baseline, the hydra will be staggered again when it drops below 50% of that total.

abilities.name: Sprout seventh head

nastierSpecials.name: Sprout eighth head
nastierSpecials.effect: You know the drill.

traits.name: Flight
traits.description: All lammasu fly.  Warrior lammasu fly with upright dignity, sometimes a bit slower than is wise.  Fallen lammasu fly well enough to keep up with all but the quickest demons.  Lammasu wizards and priests fly more gracefully than the warriors, but only because they’re less eager to run into things.

traits.name: Minor servitors
traits.description: When a lammasu isn’t in combat or resting in stone-form, it’s usually surrounded by a fawning retinue of spirit servants.  The servants look like people from ages the world no longer remembers.  They stick close to the lammasu, seldom or never speak, and in truth may be a projection of the lammasu’s spirit or will.  The spirits are no use in combat, but they can manipulate small objects such as combs and scented perfumes to use upon the lammasu’s beard, hair, and jewelry.

traits.name: Stone rest
traits.description:
Outside the overworld, lammasu who wish to rest can transform themselves into solid stone. A lammasu can see and hear as if it were still made of flesh. It can change back to flesh as a free action, but must wait a day before returning to stone, which is no great delay for lammasu guardians whose positions extend for decades or centuries. Considering that many sculptors carve stone lammasu to place in front of or within important structures, it’s deliberately difficult for a thief or assassin to know whether he is facing a stone statue or a transformed beast.
 Note that this form of solid stone is different from the living stone form sometimes adopted by the lammasu warrior, wizard, and priest during battle.

Each time an enemy with 200 hp or fewer attacks the mummy, hit or miss, it must roll a save. On a success, it’s no longer affected by the fear aura effects of any mummy in the battle.

abilities.name: Spiritual grit
abilities.effect: When the mummy takes 20 or less from a non-fire attack, it takes no damage instead.

nastierSpecials.name: Blessing of preservation
nastierSpecials.effect: The mummy has a +4 bonus to all defences until it takes damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Bone-chilling cry
nastierSpecials.effect: Once per battle as a quick action, the mummy can issue a bone-chilling cry that seems to echo from some unseen tomb or portal and it makes a call of the sarcophagus attack.

extraEffects.effect: Half damage

attacks.name: Big shove
attacks.damage: 1d6 damage, and the target pops free from the ogre

extraEffects.effect: This power only requires a quick action (once per round) instead of a standard action when the escalation die is even.

nastierSpecials.name: Tough skin
nastierSpecials.effect: Whenever the ogre takes weapon damage, reduce that damage by 1d8 points.

extraEffects.effect: Make a second naginata attack against a nearby enemy as a free action (engaging it is not required)

attacks.name: Cone of cold
attacks.target: up to 3 nearby enemies in a group

extraEffects.effect: 1/day, and the attack affects the ogre’s allies engaged with or between enemy targets.

attacks.name: Aura of treachery
attacks.damage: The target is confused until the end of the ogre mage’s next turn

abilities.name: Aura of treachery
abilities.effect: Once per round when a nearby enemy misses the ogre mage with an attack, the ogre mage can make an aura of treachery attack against it as a free action.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: The ogre mage flies using the sheer power of its superior mind.

abilities.name: Invisibility
abilities.effect: If the ogre mage is not engaged, it can turn invisible as an at-will standard action. It becomes visible when it attacks. The ogre mage takes 1d10 damage each time it uses invisibility while it’s staggered.

abilities.name: Resist exceptional attacks 16+
abilities.effect: When a limited attack (not an at-will attack) targets this creature, the attacker must roll a natural 16+ on the attack roll or it only deals half damage.

abilities.name: Trollish regeneration 20
abilities.effect:
While an ogre mage is damaged, its uncanny flesh heals 20 hit points at the start of the ogre mage’s turn. It can regenerate five times per battle. If it heals to its maximum hit points, then that use of regeneration doesn’t count against the five-use limit.
 When the ogre mage is hit by an attack that deals fire or acid damage, it loses one use of its regeneration, and it can’t regenerate during its next turn.
 Dropping an ogre mage to 0 hp doesn’t kill it if it has any uses of regeneration left.

traits.name: Flows where it likes
traits.description: The ooze is immune to opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Ooze
traits.description: The ooze is immune to effects.  When an attack applies a condition to an ooze (dazed, hampered, weakened, ongoing damage, etc.), that condition doesn’t affect it.

attacks.name: Acid-drenched pseudopod
attacks.target: up to 4 attacks, each against a different nearby enemy
attacks.damage: 30 acid damage, and 10 ongoing acid damage

extraEffects.effect: 10 acid damage.

abilities.name: Climber
abilities.effect: A black pudding sticks to ceilings and walls when it wishes, sliding along as easily as on the floor.

abilities.name: Slippery
abilities.effect: The pudding has resist weapons 12+.

attacks.name: Shlup’n’schlorp
attacks.damage: 30 acid damage, and the cube engulfs the target (functions like a grab) if it’s smaller than the cube

extraEffects.effect: The cube can make a spasms attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Spasms
attacks.target: up to 2 attacks, each against a different nearby enemy

abilities.name: Engulf and dissolve
abilities.effect:
Targets engulfed/grabbed by the cube take 30 acid damage at the start of the cube’s turn but are not viable targets for additional attacks by the cube. Multiple targets can be held within the cube simultaneously.
 Any engulfed creature that is also staggered must begin making last gasp saves or become paralysed as the cube’s toxins overwhelm it.

attacks.name: Acid-drenched pseudopod
attacks.target: 1d4 attacks, each against a different nearby enemy

extraEffects.effect: 3 ongoing acid damage.

abilities.name: Splitter
abilities.effect: The first time an ochre jelly takes 20 or more damage from a single attack, it splits into two normal-size ochre jellies, each with half the original’s current hit points plus 2d6 hp. Treat the new jellies as undamaged jellies at their new hit point totals without the splitter ability.

extraEffects.effect: The cadre can make a second double axe attack (no more) as a free action.
The crit range of melee attacks by great fang cadre orcs expands by 3 until half the great fang cadre mob has been dropped.
The attack targets PD instead of AC.

nastierSpecials.name: On the spot mutation
nastierSpecials.effect: Whenever an attack eliminates one or more members of the mob, there is a 50% chance that each survivor gains one of these abilities: extra melee attack, damage aura: 1d20 damage vs. any enemy that starts its turn engaged with the orc, or +4 to AC.

extraEffects.effect: The crit range of attacks by orcs expands by 3 unless they are staggered.

abilities.name: Unstoppable
abilities.effect: When an orc berserker drops to 0 hp, it does not immediately die.  Ignore any damage in excess of 0 hp, roll 2d6, and give the berserker that many temporary hit points.  No other healing can affect the berserker or give it more temporary hit points.  When the temporary hp are gone, the berserker dies.

extraEffects.effect: The crit range of attacks by orcs expands by 3 unless they are staggered.

attacks.name: Battle curse
attacks.damage: 4 psychic damage, and for the rest of the battle, melee attacks by orcs deal +1d4 damage against the target (non-cumulative)

extraEffects.effect: The crit range of attacks by orcs expands by 3 unless they are staggered.
The otyugh can grab the target.
The otyugh can grab the target and make a big toothy maw attack against it as a free action.

attacks.target: one enemy it’s grabbing; includes +4 grab bonus

abilities.name: Trash nest defence
abilities.effect: The otyugh gains a +2 bonus to all defences while fighting in its nest or in similar piles of excrement and trash.

abilities.name: Tentacle flail
abilities.effect: Once per round, an otyugh can make a grasping tentacles attack as a free action against a moving nearby creature it is not engaged with; on a natural even hit, the target is grabbed and its movement stops.

attacks.name: Rip and peck
attacks.damage: 15 damage, and until the end of the owlbear’s next turn, the target is hampered (makes only basic attacks) while engaged with the owlbear

extraEffects.effect: If the escalation die is even, make another rip and peck attack.

abilities.name: Feed the cubs
abilities.effect: An owlbear that scores a critical hit against a hampered enemy tears a piece of the creature off (GM chooses a limb) and will subsequently attempt to retreat with the prize to feed its cubs.  The torn-up enemy is stunned until the end of its next turn.

abilities.name: Silent hunter
abilities.effect: Owlbears are nearly silent until they strike.  Checks to hear them approaching take a -5 penalty.

extraEffects.effect: The spider can make a rummage and filch attack against the target as a free action, even if the target isn’t staggered.

attacks.name: Rummage and filch
attacks.damage: The phase spider steals a random true magic item from the target (see below)

abilities.name: Phasing abilities
abilities.effect: As long as it didn’t just return from being out of phase, at the start of the phase spider’s turn, roll a d6 to see which of its phase and teleport abilities it can access that turn.  The spider doesn’t have to use the available ability and can attack normally, if it wishes.

abilities.name: 1-2: Short teleport
abilities.effect: As a move action, the spider can teleport anywhere it can see nearby.

abilities.name: 3: Long teleport
abilities.effect: As a move action, the spider can teleport anywhere it can see nearby or far away.

abilities.name: 4-5: Phase out
abilities.effect: As a move action, the spider can remove itself from the battlefield, returning on its next initiative turn anywhere it choose nearby.  It doesn’t get to make a phase roll at the start of its next turn though.

abilities.name: 6: Teleport away
abilities.effect: If the spider has stolen at least one magic item, as a move action it can teleport back to its lair, or to its master if it has one.  It leaves the battle.  If it hasn’t stolen an item yet, it won’t leave and can use its choice of the other abilities this turn.

abilities.name: Stolen items
abilities.effect: If the spider is slain before it leaves battle, all items stolen from the party are recovered.  If a d20 roll results in a 20, other magic items are found.

traits.name: Glamour
traits.description: Outside of combat, pixies can create complex illusions at will.  For the PC, it’s usually a normal or hard skill check to sort out what’s real.

extraEffects.effect: The pixie warrior can make a madness attack against the target as a free action.

attacks.name: Enchanged bowshot
attacks.damage: 4 psychic damage, and the pixie warrior can make a madness attack against the target as a free action.

attacks.name: Madness
attacks.damage:
The target is maddened until the end of the pixie’s next turn. The first thing the creature does on its turn is use a standard action to make a display of power that has no practical benefit. The GM chooses the attacck, spell, or other power, which should be the most powerful one the character has, preferably a daily. The target expends the power in a great show of prowess, aimed for display rather than effect. Wizards cast their fireballs into the sky, monks demonstrate flawless form while shadow-boxing, and clerics bless the very stones underfoot instead of allies
 When the madness effect gets old, substitute any of the following effects, by choice or at random

extraEffects.effect: You love pixies and hate those who threaten them.  The target is confused until the end of the pixie’s next turn.
Brains knocked loose.  The target takes 4 psychic damage each time it takes an action (save ends; yes that could be 3 times per round or more).
Reality bender.  The target takes 5 ongoing psychic damage.  Each time the target fails the save, the ongoing damage increases by 5, cumulative.

Massive attack on the unconscious mind.  The target chooses one: either let the onslaught slam its mind (take 15 psychic damage), or steel its mind against the onslaught (stunned until the end of the pixie’s next turn).

Compulsion to dance.  The target takes 5 ongoing psychic damage (no save) until it spends a standard action to dance maniacally.  Dancing ends all such ongoing damage, even if the target has been hit multiple times with this effect.
Pacifism.  The target can’t attack until the end of the pixie’s next turn.

abilities.name: Dazzling light
abilities.effect: During battle, pixies fill the air with the light and sound of countless flashy illusions.  The effects are disorientating enough that the PCs don’t get to add the escalation die to their attacks.

abilities.name: Flight
abilities.effect: Pixies maky flying look like a lot of fun.

abilities.name: Invisibility
abilities.effect: When an enemy attacks a pixie and misses, the pixie turns invisible until the start of its next turn (even if it makes opportunity attacks).  A pixie can also turn invisible as a standard action, in which case the invisibility still lasts until the start of its next turn.

extraEffects.effect: The rakshasa can make a rend mind attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Striped lightning bolts
attacks.damage: 25 lightning damage, or 50 lightning damage against a staggered target

extraEffects.effect: The rakshasa can make a rend mind attack as a free action.

attacks.name: Rend mind
attacks.damage: 15 psychic damage, and the target is confused (make a basic or at-will attack vs. ally) until the end of the rakshasa’s next turn

abilities.name: Shapechange
abilities.effect: As a standard action, the rakshasa can change its form to that of any humanoid, or back to its own shape.  Seeing through the shapechange requires a DC 25 skill check.

nastierSpecials.name: Master of chaos
nastierSpecials.effect: The rakshasa gains a bonus to all defences equal to the current number of confused enemies in the battle.

nastierSpecials.name: Reversal of fate
nastierSpecials.effect: Once per day as a quick action, the rakshasa steals the escalation die; until the end of the battle the rakshasa gains an attack bonus equal to the die’s value when it was stolen.  Reset the escalation die to 0 for the players and increase it normally with each new round.

extraEffects.effect: Increase the escalation die by 1, and the target is hampered (makes only basic attacks) until the end of its next turn.

attacks.name: Barbed crossbow
attacks.target: one nearby enemy, or a far away enemy at -2 atk

abilities.name: Blood frenzy

abilities.name: Water breather
abilities.effect: Sahuagin breathe underwater and swim very well.

nastierSpecials.name: Demon-touched
nastierSpecials.effect: Roll a d6 on the demon abilities table.  The sahuagin gains that ability.

traits.name: Resist weapons 16+

extraEffects.effect: The target moves down 1d3 points in initiative order, to a minimum of 1.
5 damage.

extraEffects.effect: The hound leaves teeth in the wound; the target takes 5 ongoing damage, and the hound takes 1d6 damage.

abilities.name: Chomp chomp chomp
abilities.effect: Enemies with a lower initiative than the hound take a -5 penalty to disengage checks against it.

abilities.name: Skilled intercept 11+
abilities.effect: Once per round, an engaged skeletal hound can attempt to pop free and intercept an enemy moving past it.  Roll a normal save; on 11+, it succeeds.

extraEffects.trigger: Natural even hit, or any hit against a weakened, stunned, or confused target
extraEffects.effect: Randomly selected one of the target’s limited-use powers or spells.  The soul flenser flenses it away, removing it from the target until that creature regains it via a successful connection to the oversoul (see below).
The target is confused (save ends).
The target is weakened (save ends).
It the target is already weakened, it’s also stunned until end of its next turn.
The target is confused (save ends).

abilities.effect: When a creature slays a soul flenser, it can roll a hard save (16+). If it succeeds, the creature regains one power it has had flensed away.

abilities.effect: When an enemy misses the soul flenser with an attack against MD, that attack takes half the miss damage, if any.

abilities.name: Underkraken teleport
abilities.effect: A soul flenser that has successfully flensed at least once can (and usually will, provided some of its enemies are confused, weakened, or stunned) use a standard action to prepare itself to teleport.  Once it does this, during its next turn it can use a move action to teleport back to its home underkraken, no matter how distant, leaving the battle behind.  Soul flensers fighting beside or within their underkraken can’t use this ability; they’re already home.

nastierSpecials.name: Flensing escalator
nastierSpecials.effect: The soul flenser gains an attack bonus equal to the escalation die against creatures that have had one or more powers flensed away.

nastierSpecials.name: Oversoul control
nastierSpecials.effect: While confused by a soul flenser’s effect, a creature that has had a power flensed away can use and re-use that limited power against their erstwhile allies, if that GM sees how to use the power in a useful way.

attacks.name: Fists, claws, or shoddy weapons
attacks.damage: 20 damage, or 40 damage against a target that currently has one or more powers flensed away

abilities.name: Connection to the oversoul
abilities.effect: When a creature slays one of the flensed, it can roll a hard save (16+). If it succeeds, the creature regains one power it had flensed away.

abilities.name: Flensing escalator
abilities.effect: The flensed gains an attack bonus equal to the escalation die against creatures that have had one or more power flensed away.

traits.name: Aura of loss
traits.description: The first time during a battle the spectre is staggered, a wave of loss rolls out from it in all directions.  Each nearby enemy with 30 hp or fewer is hampered until the end of the spectre’s next turn.  (9<sup>th</sup> level dread spectre affects enemies with 60 hp or fewer.

traits.name: Healing drain
traits.description: When an enemy engaged with a spectre heals, it heals only half the normal hit points, and the spectre heals the other half (round down).

traits.name: Spectral evasion
traits.description: Once per battle as a free action when an enemy attacks the spectre, it can force the attacker to reroll the attack and use the result the spectre prefers.

extraEffects.effect: Each enemy engaged with the spectre (including the target) takes 20 negative energy damage.

attacks.name: Death grasp
attacks.target: one nearby enemy with 60 hp or fewer

abilities.name: Phantom movement
abilities.effect: As a move action when the escalation die is odd, the spectre can teleport anywhere nearby, dematerialising from its location to materialise in another.

abilities.name: Punishing aura
abilities.effect: When an enemy attacks the spectre and misses, it takes 24 negative energy damage.

abilities.name: Wrack and ruin
abilities.effect: While a spectre is in the battle, the PCs don’t add the escalation die to attack rolls, but it does.

nastierSpecials.name: Death grasp
nastierSpecials.effect: At the start of each of the spectre’s turns, if any enemy in the battle has 60 hp or fewer, the spectre can make a death grasp attack against one of those enemies as a free action. Be sure to let players see this one coming.

extraEffects.effect: Each enemy engaged with the spectre (including the target) takes 4 negative energy damage.

abilities.name: Wrack and ruin
abilities.effect: While a spectre is in the battle, the PCs don’t add the escalation die to attack rolls, but it does.

traits.name: Free-form ability - Demolish
traits.description: Given time, treants are capable of pulling apart just about anything that’s been put together.  Their roots squeeze into spaces between paving stones, slowly pulling them up and out of place.  Their branches can likewise worm their way into spaces in walls, doors, and gates, and with steady pressure they can pull down most human-made structures.  This slow-motion destruction takes minutes for the simplest efforts and hours for major demolition.

abilities.name: Hardwood resistance
abilities.effect: This creature has resist damage 12+ to all damage except fire damage and melee weapon damage, which damages it normally.

attacks.name: Grasping branches

abilities.name: Fire fire fire!
abilities.effect: When the treant takes 15 or more fire damage from a single attack, it releases all grabbed creatures.

abilities.name: Hardwood resistance
abilities.effect: This creature has resist damage 12+ to all damage except fire damage and melee weapon damage, which damages it normally.

attacks.damage: 80 damage, and the target is dazed (save ends). If the treant starts its turn grabbing a dazed enemy, it can make a titanic rend attack against that target as a standard action that turn

extraEffects.effect: 40 damage.

attacks.name: Titanic rend
attacks.damage: 160 damage, and the treant titan can continue making titanic rend attacks against the target until it escapes the grab, at which point the treant will have to use a grasping branches attack against it again.

nastierSpecials.name: Gauntlet of branches
nastierSpecials.effect: Countless smaller branches whip through the air around the treant titan.  When a creature engaged with the treant misses it with an attack, that creature takes 12 damage from the whipping branches.

traits.name: Trog stench
traits.description:
Trogs spray scents that stink so badly that other humanoids take penalties to all attacks, defences, and saves when engaged with a troglydtye or when nearby three or more troglodytes. Non-humanoids aren’t affected.
 Humanoids affected by trog stench can make a normal save (with a penalty) at the end of each of their turns. If the save succeeds, the humanoid can ignore all trog stench for the rest of the battle.
Elves, gnolls, gnomes
Humans, halflings, half-elves, holy ones, tieflings, etc.
Half-orcs, draconics
Dwarves
Forgeborn

extraEffects.effect: Damage equal to the penalty the trog’s stench currently imposes on the target.

abilities.name: Chameleon
abilities.effect: Underground, or in swamps and rivers, attacks against troglodytes by enemies who aren’t engaged with them take a -4 penalty.

abilities.name: Chameleon

abilities.name: Chameleon

While a troll is damaged, its rubbery flesh heals 10 hit points at the start of the troll’s turn. It can regenerate five times per battle. If it heals to its maximum hit points, then that use of regeneration doesn’t count against the five-use limite
 When the troll is hit by an attack that deals fire or acid damage, it loses one use of its regeneration, and it can’t regenerate during its next turn.

nastierSpecials.name: Increased regeneration
nastierSpecials.effect: Increase the troll’s regeneration dice; the baseline amount a troll regenerates should run about 1/9 of its total hp, but you can go higher to be nasty.

nastierSpecials.name: Mutant
nastierSpecials.effect: Fire and acid don’t hurt the troll’s regeneration; lightning does instead.

nastierSpecials.name: Rending
nastierSpecials.effect: If both claw attacks hit the same target, the target also takes 10 ongoing damage.

The target is also weakened until the end of its next turn (-4 attacks and defences).  In addition, the target expends one unused limited trait (a spell, power, or talent with a once-per-battle or daily use, but not magic item powers) of its choice.

attacks.name: Vampiric compulsion
attacks.damage: The target is confused and vulnerable ((save ends)

extraEffects.effect: The vampire can use vampiric compulsion as a free action only when a nearby enemy attacks the vampire and misses with a natural attack roll of 1-5.

abilities.name: Vampiric regeneration
abilities.effect: The vampire regenerates 1 hp per level at the start of each round indefinitely, but it turns to mist if it drops to 0 hp (see below).

abilities.name: Mist form
abilities.effect: Unless it is slain in a manner appropriate for truly killing vampires in the campaign, a vampire that drops to 0 hp drifts away to return and fight some other day.

nastierSpecials.name: Vampiric compulsion
nastierSpecials.effect: The vampire gains the use of the vampiric compulsion power.

attacks.damage: 7 damage, and a humanoid target is weakened (-4 attack and defences) until the end of the vampire spawn’s next turn

traits.name: Quick action
traits.description: Once per round as a quick action, the werebeast can shift form.  The hybrid form is the most powerful in combat, but the humanoid and beast forms are useful for various activities outside of combat as well.

traits.name: Stats
traits.description: The stats below work for the beast and hybrid forms.  If a werebeast ends up fighting in humanoid form, subtract 2 from all its defences and halve its normal attack damage.

traits.name: Beast heart (all three forms)
traits.description: Animals of the werebeast’s type are intuitively on good terms with the were, even dire animals.  If the werebeast betrays them, however, retaliation is certain and merciless.

traits.name: Cursed bite (hybrid or animal form only)
traits.description: While the moon is full, the first time each battle a creature takes damage from a werebeast melee attack, it takes 10 extra damage (champion: 20 damage; epic: 40 damage).  The malignant curse, transmitted through the attack, shocks the mortal flesh.  Further attacks, even from weres of different types, don’t cause extra damage.  Unless blessed, purged, or otherwise cursed, the damaged creature will turn into a werebeast on the night of the next full moon.  Heroes powerful enough to fight werebeasts can usually find benefactors or rituals to cure them, but there’s an exception to every rule.  GM, if you’re unsure whether it’s a full moon, roll a d10.  On a 1-3, the moon is full enough.

traits.name: Resilient shifting (all three forms)
traits.description: A werebeast can shift forms once per round as a quick action.  When a werebeast shifts, it can roll a save against one save ends effect.

traits.name: Moon fury (hybrid form only)
traits.description: While fighting in moonlight, a werebeast gains a bonus to damage equal to its level (champion: double its level; epic: triple it). This ability is extremely nasty when combined with the bestial fury most werebeasts have.

extraEffects.effect: The werebear grabs the target. As a standard action, it can make a head chomp attack against an enemy it’s grabbing.

abilities.name: Unatural vigour (hybrid or animal form only)
abilities.effect: When the wererat is not staggered at the start of its turn, it heals 5 hp.

abilities.name: Bestial fury (hybrid form only)
abilities.effect: Wererats gain a bonus to damage equal to the escalation die (champion: double the die; epic: quadruple the die).

nastierSpecials.name: Uncanny moves
nastierSpecials.effect: The wererat takes no damage and suffers no effects from attacks that miss.

nastierSpecials.name: Piercing shriek
nastierSpecials.effect: Once per battle when the escalation die is 2+ and there are three or more wererats in the battle, a wererat can make a piercing shriek attack as a free action. Usually all the wererats in the battle will do this at the same time.

extraEffects.effect: The weretiger can make a second claws and bite attack as a free action.
The weretiger can make a third claws and bite attack as a free action if the escalation die is 3+.
When an enemy engages the weretiger, if the weretiger isn’t already engaged, it can make a springing strike attack against that enemy as an interrupt action before the attack.

abilities.name: Bestial fury (hybrid form only)
abilities.effect: Weretigers gain a bonus to damage equal to the escalation die (champion: double the die; epic: quadruple the die).

abilities.name: Unnatural vigour (hybrid or animal form only)
abilities.effect: When the weretiger is not staggered at the start of its turn, it heals 24 hp.

nastierSpecials.name: Stymie
nastierSpecials.effect: When the weretiger hits with a springing strike attack, the target pops free from it and can’t take any more actions that turn unless it succeeds on a save.

extraEffects.effect: The werewolf gains a +2 attack bonus (cumulative) to ravening bite attacks until the end of the battle.

abilities.name: Bestial fury (hybrid form only)
abilities.effect: Werewolves gain a bonus to damage equal to the escalation die (champion: double the die; epic: quadruple the die).

abilities.name: Pack attack
abilities.effect: When the werewolf attacks a creature that is engaged with one of its allies, the target is vulnerable to that attack.

abilities.name: Unnatural vigour (hybrid or animal form only)
abilities.effect: When the werewolf is not staggered at the start of its turn, it heals 8 hp.

nastierSpecials.name: Sustaining blood
nastierSpecials.effect: When the werewolf hits with a ravening bite sttack, it heals 4 hp.

extraEffects.effect: Unless the wight is staggered, the attack also deals 8 ongoing negative energy damage.

nastierSpecials.name: Barrow-touch
nastierSpecials.effect: The wight’s attacks against enemies taking ongoing negative energy damage are against PD instead of AC and have an expanded crit range expands by 2.

extraEffects.effect: The target is also weakened (save ends).

attacks.name: Spiraling assault
attacks.damage: 10 negative energy damage, and after the attack the wraith teleports to and engages with one target it hit

extraEffects.effect: The wraith can use spiraling assault only when the escalation die is even.

abilities.name: Ghostly
abilities.effect:
The creature has resist damage 16+ to all damage (including holy damage) except force damage, which damages it normally.
 A wraith can move through solid objects, but it can’t end its movement inside them.

nastierSpecials.name: Drain life
nastierSpecials.effect: The wraith heals half the damage it deals when it hits with a natural 18+ attack roll.

extraEffects.effect: The wyvern can make a deadly tail stinger attack during its next turn.

attacks.name: Deadly tail stinger
attacks.damage: 15 damage, and the target takes 10 ongoing poison damage (difficult save ends, 16+)

nastierSpecials.name: Escalating poison
nastierSpecials.effect: Add the escalation die to the wyvern’s ongoing poison damage whenever that damage is dealt.

extraEffects.effect: Both the zombie and its target take 4d6 damage!

abilities.name: Headshot
abilities.effect: A critical hit against a zombie drops it to 0 hp.

extraEffects.effect: Both the zombie and its target take 6d10 damage!

abilities.name: Headshot
abilities.effect: A critical hit against a giant zombie mook deals triple damage instead of the normal double damage for a crit.

abilities.name: Double-strength mook
abilities.effect: The giant zombie mook counts as two 9th level mooks when you are building battles.

extraEffects.effect: Both the zombie and the target take 3d10 damage.
The target takes 20 psychic damage.

abilities.name: Death spasms
abilities.effect: When a headless zombie drops to 0 hp, it flails with its fists and makes a mouthless cry attack as a free action before it dies.

abilities.name: Inevitable hunger
abilities.effect: When a creature tries to affect the zombie’s attack, such as forcing a reroll or applying a penalty, it must roll a normal save; on a failure, the effect is negated.

nastierSpecials.name: Baleful aura
nastierSpecials.effect: While nearby a headless zombie, when a creature would heal, it only heals half the normal hit points.

nastierSpecials.name: Necrotic supremacy
nastierSpecials.effect: When the escalatioin die increases to 6, each headless zombie in the battle is restored to maximum hit points, including the dead ones.

extraEffects.effect: Both the zombie and its target take 1d6 damage!

abilities.name: Headshot
abilities.effect: A critical hit against a zombie drops it to 0 hp.

nastierSpecials.name: Eat brains
nastierSpecials.effect: More dangerous zombies don’t try to kill the moving targets before feasting on brains; they keep attacking any enemy they’ve knocked unconscious, rolling attacks againt the helpless enemy until it’s dead.

attacks.name: Smash
attacks.damage: 20 damage, and the zombie can only attack using gutburst during its next turn

extraEffects.effect: Both the zombie and its target take 2d6 damage.

attacks.name: Gutburst
attacks.damage: The target takes 3 ongoing acid damage from a spray of stinking zombified gut juice.  The zombie takes 1d6 damage

abilities.name: Headshot
abilities.effect: The first time an enemy crits the zombie, the beast must roll a save.  If it succeeds, it takes normal crit damage.  If it fails, it drops to 0 hp.  A second crit just drops the thing.

nastierSpecials.name: Ghastly thrashing
nastierSpecials.effect: When the zombie beast is first staggered, it makes a thrash attack as a free action.

extraEffects.effect: Both the zombie and its target take 1d6 damage.

attacks.name: Curse
attacks.damage: The target is weakened until the start of the zombie’s next turn.

abilities.name: Hand of the fallen
abilities.effect: When a melee attack drops one or more Silver Rose mooks, the hand of one of those zombies ends up severed from its owner and latched onto a nearby enemy.  The afflicted creature is vulnerable to all attacks until the hand is removed, which takes a standard action by that creature or an ally next to them.

abilities.name: Shot to the head
abilities.effect: When an attack drops this zombie and it had 2, 4, or 6 hp remaining, the attack deals the same amount of damage to another member of the mob.  If this zombie has any other number of hit points left?  No hit to the head.

nastierSpecials.name: Curse of failure
nastierSpecials.effect: Each round, one zombie mook in the Silver Rose mob can make a curse attack as a quick action.

nastierSpecials.name: Mob rule
nastierSpecials.effect: The curse gains an attack bonus equal to the number of Silver Rose zombies in the battle.

extraEffects.effect: Both the zombie and its target take 1d4 damage!

abilities.name: Headshot
abilities.effect: A critical hit against a zombie shuffler deals triple damage instead of the normal double damage for a crit.
